dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under gloomy sky a huge fortress looms on a volcanic mountainside.  From within WE HEAR the agonizing scream of a woman giving birth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scream continues as WE MOVE THROUGH the grim corri- dors of the castle TOWARD stairs leading down to a dungeon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silhouetted in sadows, three Nockmaar MINIONS stand guard.  In a jail cell, sex fully pregnant WOMEN watch from behind iron bars.  The screaming stops.  There's a moment of silence.  As WE MOVE INTO another jail cell WE HEAR a slap and the first cry of a newborn BABY. In the cell a black-robed DRUID watches intensely as ETHNA, a midwife, leans over the MOTHER and wraps the baby in swaddling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it a girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show me its arm. Ethna peels back the swaddling.  On the baby's arm is a small marking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's true then.  I must tell Queen Bavmorda. With great urgency the druid hurries up the dungeon stairs.  Ethna gently places the baby on the mother's breast.  The mother comforst the baby lovingly until it stops crying.  Then she reaches out and clasps the midwife's wrist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ethna, please.  Help me.  They're going to kill my baby. Ethna nervously looks out at the guards, then shakes her head at the mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please save my baby. Ethna hesitates.  Then decides.  She quickly wraps to- gether some rags and gives them to the mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretend this is the child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Ethna.  Thank you. The mother kisses her baby and hands it to Ethna, who hides the baby inside the basket of rags.  Ethna car- ries the basket past the guards and up the stairs. The mother lies back and sighs with relief.  Then she hears clinking bootsteps and her eyes widen with fear. QUEEN BAVMORDA sweeps down the dungeon stairs, her black robes flowing behind her.  The druid hurries alongside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We will start the ritual at dusk. You're certain this is the one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It bears the markings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must see for myself!  Just as the omen foretold! The guards fearfully move aside as Bavmorda enters the cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So.  You *were* the one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  But nothing you can do will stop the prophecy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This child will have no power over me.... Bavmorda grabs the rags away from the mother and anxi- ously tears them apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (furiously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the baby! One of the guards looks up the stairs. GUARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The midwife! Bavmorda flies into a rage. BAVMORDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find that baby!  Use the dogs! Sorsha! Two guards draw swords and charge upstairs.  Bavmorda grabs the third guard and nods toward the mother. BAVMORDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill her. Bavmorda storms away with the druid.  WE SEE the shadow of the guard move over the terrified mother.  War drums begin to beat out an alarm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TITLES BEGIN.  The midwife hurries through swirling show, clutching the baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nockmaar troops on horseback charge into a desolate village, driving ferocious DEATH DOGS into huts, violently searching for the baby.  The oppressed, poor VILLAGERS are yanked into the street.  Some of them are beaten.  One is killed. The midwife hides behind a hut, still holding the baby, then runs away from the village.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ethna treks across an open grass field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She huddles by a fire, exhausted and hungry, her clothes filthy and torn, and she rocks the crying baby. She hears dogs howling in the distance.  She clutches the baby, kicks out the fire, and runs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She scrambles over rocks on a windswept coastline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ethna runs desperately for her life.  Chasing her are two vicious DEATH DOGS.  She scrambles across a shallow river.  She claws at rock and tears away sticks and driftwood matted together with weeds.  Into this she places the baby and sets it afloat downstream. DEATH DOG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bordak! The dogs lunge from the woods and splash across the river.  The midwife claws her way up a steep bank, lur- ing the dogs.  As they attack her: MIDWIFE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have her!  No!  No! She grabs a stick and tries to defend herself, thrash- ing at the snarling dogs. From the baby's view, as it floats down the river, WE SEE the dogs kill the midwife beyond the distant trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The little raft of sticks swirls precariously in the current.  It glances off jutting rocks, tumbles over rapids, and scrapes under overhanging trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At last the raft catches in some weeks, almost dumping the baby.

dialogues.speaker: TITLE SEQUENCE ENDS
dialogues.text: Suddenly WE HEAR rustling leaves, possibly another Death Dog.  Then WE HEAR giggling.  Two children, RANON and MIMS, watch in amazement from the riverbank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holding onto a plow, WILLOW UFGOOD struggles behind a huge hog.  From a heavy sack slung over his shoulder he tosses seeds. RANON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dada!  We found something in the river! Willow beams with joy as his son and daughter race to- ward him.  They grab his sleeves and tug him away from his plow. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't run off and play with you now.  I've got work to do. RANON/MIMS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Dada, you gotta see it!  Hurry! Willow drops his sack of seeds.  The ugly hog glares at him like a guilty conscience.  The children squeal with excitement as their father runs toward the river with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE SEE Willow from the baby's view.  His eyes pop open. He quickly backs his children away. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back!  Don't go near it.  We don't know where it's been.  It could be diseased. MIMS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a baby! RANON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not a Nelwyn baby. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's too big to be a Nelwyn baby.  It looks like a daikini... MIMS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooh, it's so cute... WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mims!  Get back here!  It might bite you. Willow drags Mims away.  Then the baby starts crying. RANON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't we keep it, Dada? WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely not. BURGLEKUTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ufgood!  Willow Ufgood! Willow, in a sudden panic, sees BURGLEKUTT in the dis- tance.  He splashes into the river, grabs the raft, plunks it on the bank and tries to hush the crying baby. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh, shhh!  It's the Prefect -- that's all I need.  Mims, Ranon, keep this thing hidden...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burglekutt's beady eyes spot Willow making a mad dash for his plow.  Swinging his fat stomach, he angrily points his walking stick and goes after him. KIAYA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Burglekutt!  He hasn't done anything wrong! Willow's wife KIAYA chases Burglekutt across the field, her beautiful long hair flowing behind her.  Willow quickly gets behind his plow like he's been there all day. BURGLEKUTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ufgood!  What do you think you're doing!  I tell the planting seeds in this village. KIAYA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told him we didn't steal it, Wil- low. Burglekutt furiously scoops a handful of seeds out of Willow's sack and shakes them under Willow's nose. BURGLEKUTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You haven't paid your debts.  Where did you get these seeds? With pride, Willow puts his arm around his wife. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the forest.  My family's been gathering them since last fall. There's no law against that, Bur- glekutt. Suddenly the children laugh in the distance. KIAYA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willow!  You left the children alone by the river?? In alarm she runs off before Willow can stop her.  Bur- glekutt sweeps the horizon with his walking stick. BURGLEKUTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too late, Ufgood.  You'll never get your planting done before the rains start.  You're gonna lose this land. He raises the seeds high above his head, then smashes them down at Willow's boots.  He waddles away toward two of his MEN who wait by the road.  Then:  Kiaya SHRIEKS from the river.  Burglekutt stops in his tracks and shakes his head as if to say "the whole family's crazy."  Off he trudges.  Willow watches and waits. Then runs as fast as he can to the river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kiaya cradles the baby in her arms.  Willow runs up, and with patriarchal authority, puts his fists on his hips. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely, under no condition, is anyone in this family going to fall in love with that baby. They all fall in love as he speaks.  The children fol- low Kiaya up on the bank, walking right past Willow. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kiaya!  We can't keep that baby. Mims, Ranon.  Hey!  I will not be ignored! Ignored, Willow huffs after them across his unplowed field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willow nervously paces as Kiaya pours water in a wood tub and the children entertain the naked baby with sticks and brightly colored cloths, apparatus for a magic trick. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is bad.  If we're caught with that little daikini it'll be the end of us.  Careful, Ranon, I need that for the festival. (indicates magic cloth) Kiaya, what are we going to do? KIAYA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna give this baby a bath. The baby squeals with joy as Kiaya lifts her into the bath. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burglekutt's right.  There's not enough time to finish plowing. We'll lose everything and I'll end up working in the mines. He shudders at the thought. KIAYA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willow, do you think we should take her to the Village Council? WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no!  They'll think it's a bad omen.  There'll be a flood or a drought or a plague and everybody'll blame me for it! RANON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look.  What's that? Willow leans forward.  On the baby's shoulder is a small branded scar in a circular design.  It only adds to Willow's fears. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  This is trouble. I'll talk to the High Aldwin about it tomorrow at the Festival. The baby kicks and splashes and giggles in the bath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The raucous BAND plays as NELWYNS dance and celebrate amid brochs and wheelhouses garlanded with flowers.  A crowd cheers wildly as MINERS battle FARMERS in a tug- of-war, finally yanking the farmers face-first into a puddle of mud.  On a stage a HARLEQUIN dances delight- fully.  While on a raised platform the five members of the VILLAGE COUNCIL sit and observe, mildly amused. The head councilman is Burglekutt. The WE SEE Willow on another stage.  He flourishes his colorful sticks and cloths.  In the audience WE NOTICE his friend MEEGOSH, who wears a miner's apron, rooting Willow on. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now!  For our final amazing bit of magic, I will make an entire pig completely disappear! Meegosh applauds as Mims and Ranon trot out lugging a tiny baby pig in a crate.  As Willow takes the pig out it bites his hand and gets away.  Willow tackles and squashes it.  The crowd laughs and half of them leave, and Meegosh covers his face. Mims and Ranon rapidly wave a bright blanket.  Willow cleverly whips the pig under his legs and behind his back and suddenly it's gone!  Impresse, the crowd gasps.  Then the pig squeals and dashes through Willow's legs and leaps off the stage. CROWD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaww!  Booo!  Sssss! Burglekutt and the Council shake their heads as Willow, embarassed, picks up his things.  Meegosh trots up with the pig under his arm. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meegosh, I'm in trouble. MEEGOSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, it wasn't that bad.  You need a better pig, that's all. But as they walk past the Village Council, and Bur- glekutt sneers down at Willow, Meegosh catches on. MEEGOSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Burglekutt's got you in the squeeze.  Soon you'll be down in the mines like me. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mining.  I hate closed-in spaces. That's the last thing I'd ever do. (he shudders)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta get my crop planted. MEEGOSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I'll help you as much as I can, Willow. The Village Council members stand up respectfully as the wise old HIGH ALDWIN hobbles through the adoring crowd.  Mims and Ranon rush up to Willow with several other children who are eating candy. MIMS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dada, can we get treacle candy? Can we, can we?  Please? WILLOW (preoccupied)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meegosh, can you watch the chil- dren?  I gotta talk to the High Aldwin. MEEGOSH (truly amazed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The High Aldwin??  Why? But Willow has already wandered into the crowd, leaving Meegosh with a dozen sugar-charged children and a pig. Willow desperately pushes past people and finally reaches the High Aldwin. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir!  I have to talk to you. HIGH ALDWIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not today, Willow. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a matter of great importance to me! Burglekutt stares angrily from his platform.  Slightly annoyed, the High Aldwin stops and places his hand on Willow's shoulder. HIGH ALDWIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Intuition, Willow -- remember?  I know you're eager to be my appren- tice, Willow.  But today is the spring festival. Suddenly a walking stick is pointed at Willow's nose. BURGLEKUTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apprentice?  To the High Aldwin!! Willow Ufgood??? His belly shakes as he howls with laughter, encouraging his councilmen to join in.  Willow shrinks away, em- barassed. Then a terrified SHRIEK shatters the festivity.  Music  stops and people grab their children and run for their lives.  A DEATH DOG rips a trail of destruction through the village. Meegosh holds onto Ranon and Mims.  But when Mims sees Willow she runs right out into the open.  Willow charges twoard her, tackling her and rolling away from the beast's claws. DEATH DOG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bordak!  Bordak! A loud war cry distracts the dog.  VOHNKAR, the toughest warrior in the village, leads a charging army of miners and farmers wielding shovels and picks.  Wil- low and Meegosh grab sticks.  The Nelwyns battle the Death Dog.  At last, Vohnkar drives a spear through its chest and it dies hideously. MEEGOSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was it looking for? A VILLAGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It said "bordak"!  What does it mean? COUNCILMAN (scholarly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby!  It means baby!  It was look- ing for somebody's baby! Mothers grab their children, people look around the wrecked village in terror.  There's a haunting silence. MIMS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy? Suddenly alarmed, Willow races towrd his distant farm, his children hurrying behind. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kiaya!  Kiaya!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willow bursts in and finds Kiaya calmly feeding the baby.  Relieved, he throws his arms around her. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't keep this baby, Kiaya.  We must take her to the Council. The children run in and they all huddle together, cher- ishing their precious lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arguing villagers pack the church-shaped room to the open door at the back and into the balconies above. The councilmen sit on a platform at the front, with the High Aldwin seated in a special chair above them.  Tak- ing charge, Burglekutt stands and pounds the floor with his walking stick. BURGLEKUTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An evil beast from the outer world has invaded our peaceful village, looking for a baby! This only adds to the frenzy. A VILLAGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a sign!  An omen! ANOTHER VILLAGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our crops will die! BURGLEKUTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence!  One beast we can kill. But there may be more!  And they won't give up their search till they've found what they're looking for! MEEGOSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whose baby is it! OTHER VILLAGERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's to blame for this! Amid the chaos the High Aldwin slowly stands up.  As if he senses something, he looks over the crowd toward the back. At the back door, holding the baby, Willow tries to push his way through the jostling crowd.  The High Aldwin raises his hand.  It flashes magically.  He points as he speaks: HIGH ALDWIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willow Ufgood!  Come before me! The crowd stands apart as Willow walks the length of the room.  Kiaya and the children follow part way and then stand aside next to Meegosh.  Burglekutt simmers as Willow approaches the platform. HIGH ALDWIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earlier today you tried to tell me something, Willow. WILLOW (bows his head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My family found this baby in the river, High Aldwin. The crowd stirs but the High Aldwin silences them with a simple gesture.  He gazes down at the baby mysteri- ously. HIGH ALDWIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A daikini child... (his eyes close)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...of some importance, I feel... BURGLEKUTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what the beasts want!  Give it back! The crowd rumbles, many agree. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll kill her!  We can't let this baby die! BURGLEKUTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we care! Burglekutt whips up the shouting crowd.  The High Aldwin raises his hands, feeling the air above him. Almost in a trance: HIGH ALDWIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...importance...yes...this child is special... COUNCILMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What should we do? Instantly, the High Aldwin drops his arms and opens his eyes. HIGH ALDWIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This child must be taken beyond the boundaries of our village.  All the way to the daikini crossroads. The room goes silent. A VILLAGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who will do that? SEVERAL VILLAGERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vohnkar!  Vohnkar! Vohnkar the warrior elbows his way to the front and pounds his chest once with his fist. HIGH ALDWIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The outer world is dangerous and corrupt, Vohnkar.  And this baby is hunted by blood-hungry beasts.  Are you willing to sacrifice your life? Brave Vohnkar swallows and shifts his weight doubtful- ly. VOHNKAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I go, who'll defend you if other  beasts attack? The crowd rumbles and shouts, and Vohnkar mops his brow and scuttles away from the platform. BURGLEKUTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's right!  It seems only fair that the man to take this baby to the crossroads... (walking stick up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...be the very man who plucked it... (walking stick down) ...out of the river! All eyes turn to Willow.  Kiaya gasps and Meegosh holds her back. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do it!  I haven't put my crop in! A COUNCILMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You caused this trouble.  You found the baby...you get rid of it! BURGLEKUTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I nominate Willow Ufgood! The crowd cheers wildly.  The High Aldwin steps forward to the edge of the platform.  With a flourish he waves his arms. HIGH ALDWIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will consult the bones! Something rattles as he shakes his cupped hands.  The crowd jumps away.  The High Aldwin scatters small bones across the floor below him.  He leans down and studies the bones.  Willow looks at Kiaya, who is worried and afraid.  The High Aldwin speaks softly to him: HIGH ALDWIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bones tell me nothing. (he eyes Willow)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I must make a decision.  Is there love in your heart for this child? Willow hesitates.  He looks at the baby. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. The High Aldwin bolts straight up, broadcasting: HIGH ALDWIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bones have spoken!  Willow? The security of this village depends on you! The people shout and cheer and applaud and begin to leave.  Kiaya and Meegosh and the children push their way toward Willow, who stands there staring at the baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kiaya's hair hangs down her back in a long tight braid. Near the fire she packs supplies into a travel sack. On the other side of the fire, Willow diapers the baby. The house is quiet. MIMS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dada? Willow sets the baby down.  He goes around an opne wall an sits on his daughter's bed, straightening her blank- ets and toys. MIMS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch out for brownies, Dada. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will, Mims.  Goodnight. He smiles and kisses her.  Then crosses over to Ranon's b RANON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dada, what's a daikini? WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daikinis are giant people who live far far away. RANON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you scared? Willow shrugs.  Ranon sits up in bed. RANON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could be you rguard!  I could carry your spear! WILLOW (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a great son you are, Ranon.  I wish I could take you with me.  Now go to sleep... Ranon slides down under his blankets.  Willow kisses him, looks at him a moment, then quietly withdraws to- ward the fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The silhouette of a distant hill with druid stones on top. Carrying the baby, Willow climbs the hill with his fami- ly.  He wears a papoose rig, supply pack, and a dagger. He hands the baby to Kiaya, then walks through the towering stones.  The High Aldwin solemnly looks out at the distant forest. HIGH ALDWIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, you know where you're going? (Willow shakes his head) Down there, through those trees, follow the river.  You'll know the crossroads by a big daikini struc- ture.  Willow, this is serious business.  Don't waste any time, the outer world is no place for a Nelwyn.  Give the baby to the first daikini you see, then hurry home as fast as you can. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I'm not strong enough to be your apprentice, how can I do this? HIGH ALDWIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're strong enough.  But you're going to need courage, Willow. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want courage.  I don't want to be a warrior.  All I've ever wanted was to do magic, real magic, like you! HIGH ALDWIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Real magic, Willow, is simply the art of controlling the reality of others.  You lack faith in your- self.  You must learn to trust your intuition. The High Aldwin picks up a rock.  With intense concen- tration he squeezes it in his outstretched hand.  Then throws it in the air.  It changes into a bird and flies away. HIGH ALDWIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go in the direction the bird is flying. WILLOW (amazed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, if I could do that I'd--I'd turn Burglekutt into a toad! HIGH ALDWIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waste magic on revenge?  You have much to learn, Willow... The High Aldwin touches Willow's shoulder and turns away.  The children are playing tag among the stones. Willow hugs them.  Kiaya places the baby in the papoose. KIAYA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willow, we've never been apart.  I miss you already.  Take this.  It will bring you luck. Kiaya, whose head is covered with a kerchief, places a braided necklace on her own hair around Willow's neck. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You cut your hair, Kiaya? He kisses her.  The adjusts the papoose and heads off down the hill.  The others wave goodbye sadly. KIAYA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willow!! Kiaya rushes down the hill and passionately throws her arms around Willow, tears in her eyes.  At last they break apart, and Willow begins the journey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willow hikes through strange and wondrous terrain, amazed and frightened.  Animals rustle in the brush and he stumbles into a thistle patch, jumping out picking burrs off his legs.  He hides from a fierce bear.  The bear sees him and runs away.  Willow hurries along, shifting the papoose, getting used to the baby's weight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The baby is fussing hungrily.  Willow impetuously digs a bladder of goat's milk from his sack and struggles to feed her.  Then he hears something.  Sensing danger, he clutches the baby and runs down a nearby riverbank.  He hides under a bridge. NOCKMAAR SOLDIERS on horseback thunder toward the bridge, led by the knight SORSHA whose face is hidden under a black helmet and visor.  In the other direction Willow sees a LIEUTENANT and two DEATH DOGS.  They all meet on the bridge.  The hideous soldiers are part hu- man, part beast. LIEUTENANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've patrolled the hills.  This is where they killed the nursemaid. SORSHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She must have done something with the child.  Widen the search! One of the Death Dogs is chewing on the Lieutenant's stirrup. LIEUTENANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get away from there! The dog panics and gnashes at the Lieutenant's arm, ripping away a piece of armor with its teeth.  Horses rear.  The Lieutenant draws his sword lightning-fast. He slices and kills the Death Dog.  The baby begins to cry but the death-howl of the beast drowns her out as it does hurtling off the bridge into the river below. The soldiers gallop off into the woods. Willow falls back against the riverbank, shrinking away from the murdered Death Dog which lies bloody and twisted in the water.  The terrified baby cries in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A harmless rabbit springs across Willow's path.  Willow trips over a stone and almost falls flat on his face. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate this.  Where am I?  I should stick you in a tree and go back home. (looks at baby)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.  I didn't mean that. He hurries along the road, looking over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Various VIEWS of Willow and the baby trekking across vast hills and valleys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gasping with exhaustion, Willow staggers up a sloping hill and drops to his knees.  His eyes brighten.  In the distance he sees a junction marked by a high wooden scaffolding. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it.  The crossroads... He stands and heads toward it cautiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is disgusting.  Littered with junk, buzzing with flies, plagued with rodents.  Willow creeps toward the scaffolding, covering his face against the stench. From it hang two cages.  In one is a heap of filthy rags.  In the other a half-clothed skeleton with one bony arm dangling out. Willow unpacks the papoose and looks up the deserted road.  He shivers with cold. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willow waits uneasily, brushing flies off his face. The baby fusses and squirms.  He peeks inside her diaper. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate this. He looks anxiously up and down the road.  The baby's crying gets worse.  He begins to change her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willow finishes building a fire, lighting it with flint and blowing it into flame.  The baby lies quietly near- by in a kind fo porta-crib made of papoose and twigs. Nightfall teems with spooky noises:  crickets, frogs, bats, owls and howling wolves.  Then a terrible moan frightens him. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really hate this. Not sure where it came from. he backs away from the fire, under the rag-filled cage.  Suddenly a hand reaches down and yanks Willow up off the ground!  Wil- low screams.  The baby cries.  And WE SEE the haggard unwashed unshaven face of MADMARTIGAN pressing against the bars of the cage. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Peck...get me some water...or you'll diiiiie...! Madmartigan shakes Willow like a rag-doll until Willow nods his head yes.  Then drops him.  Instantly Willow races around that fire, picking up everything he owns. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will--I'll getcha water--getcha lotsa water--anything you say--! Willow grabs the baby and makes a beeline for the bushes. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peck! He dives headfirst into the weeds.  Madmartigan rattles his cage. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a weasely little Peck! Gimme some water! Willow peeks at him and shakes his head. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not coming near you! They stare at each other across the fire.  Then, Mad- martigan puts on a very phony smile. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please?  I'm dyin' of thirst in here. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.  How long will it take? Madmartigan drops the smile and spits at the fire. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't make me angry, Peck. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You be careful.  I'm a powerful sorcerer.  I could turn you into a toad just like that. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miserable Pecks. Willow throws a rock at him.  It bounces off the cage. Madmartigan sags down into a heap of rags again. EXT. CROSSROADs - NIGHT The wind howls through the distant trees as darkness fall Willow rocks the baby and eats some bread.  Madmartigan watches him hungrily, sighing, forlorn, his eyes asking for pit.  Willow glances at him.  Finally, he can't take any more and he puts down the baby and pous some goat's milk in a cup.  He reaches up on tip-toes and offers the milk to Madmartigan. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's more like it. Madmartigan snatches the cup and guzzles the milk, retching horribly at the taste.  Then he tosses the cup back. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do any other daikinis ever come by here? MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to give this baby to some- body. Madmartigan grabs the bars and raises himself up. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm somebody.  Lemme out and I'll take care of your baby. He makes little kissing noises to the baby, trying to be sweet.  However, his teeth are filthy. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Somebdoy put you in there for a reason.  I'll wait for somebody else. Willow retreats to the fire.  Madmartigan whacks the cage with the back of his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the blazing fire Willow feeds the baby.  WE HEAR hoofbeats. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  Somebody's coming! MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peck!  Quick!  Douse the fire! Excited, Willow tosses more wood on the fire, picks up the baby and waits. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you fool!  Put it out I say! Out! Torches appear up the road.  A horse-drawn wagon clatters full-speed toward the fire.  WE HEAR load drunken voices, far from friendly.  Willow quickly dives into the bushes. Four boorish PICTS, with tatooed faces and arms, halt at the crossroads, yelling and waving their torches. Madmartigan is hidden under his rags.  For fun the Picts set fire to the skeleton cage.  Then head for the other. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!! He rises up in the torchlight.  The Picts taunt him. PICT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whose fire! They jab their torches at Madmartigan. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  Help!  Stop! PICT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are they?  Where did they go? Madmartigan points way up the road.  The Picts ride away.  As they go, they swing his cage and st fire to the floor of it.  Madmartigan frantically geats the flames.  His sleeves ignite. Willow scrambles out of the bushes and scoops up hand- fuls of dirt, which he chucks at Madmartigan. MADMARTIGAN (spitting out dirt)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for your help, Peck. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay? MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As if you care.  I saved your life, Peck.  Those guys woulda killed us! (points dramatically) You wanna give your baby to them?? They eat babies! WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Madmartigan literally licks his wounds, dragging his parched tongue along the length of his forearm.  Willow begins to walk away. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The world's gone insane.  Good men locked in cages, criminals running free.  It doesn't pay to be honest, Peck. Willow stops and turns around. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't call me a Peck.  My name is Willow. Madmartigan slinks down like a cat and slowly extends his derty hand through the bars. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Willow.  I'm Madmartigan. Willow stares warily at the hand.  Madmartigan smiles. Willow quickly shakes his hand and jumps away.  Madmar- tigan laughs in a harmless, friendly way. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You a woodcutter? WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farmer. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farmer!  I knew it!  You're a vic- tim, Willow.  Yep, you and me: victims of a rotten, corrupt, cor- rupt, rotten world. A rat lumbers out of the darkness and sniffs toward the baby in the porta-crib.  Madmartigan suddenly points. Willow screams and chases the rat away.  Madmartigan shakes his head as solemnly as an undertaker. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Willow my friend.  I'm really a good man.  Give me my freedom, and I'll look after that baby for you.  Trust me. After a moment, Willow takes out his dagger.  He stands on his toes under a cage, reaches up, and hacks at the chain lock.  Madmartigan's eyes widen over-eagerly.  he rubs his hands together and licks his lips. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it--good--good--like that, yes, good, good, the chain--that's it, come on--come on--! Willow suddenly steps away. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nooo, I don't think I should. Madmartigan goes berserk.  His arms flail and the whole cage shakes and swings and he bangs his head on the roof. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peck!!  Stupid Peck!  I'll kill ya! Let me out! Willow scrambles back to the fire and scoops up the baby and rocks her in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madmartigan is making something out of scraps of bark and cloth.  He smiles sweetly as Willow wakes up. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning, Willow. Willow turns his back on him and tends to the baby. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry I yelled at you.  I've been in this cage toooo long.  Can't think straight anymore.  Owww...! Willow looks over.  madmartigan pats his arms in pain. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You all right? MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These burns.  My arms.  Ouch... He holds up his arms in agony.  Willow fishes some gooey jelly out of his sack and smears a gob of it on a leaf.  He hands it up to Madmartigan. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See if this helps. Madmartigan wipes the goo all over his arms. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaaaaahhhh.  Better.  Here, I made something for the baby. He holds out a ratlle and shakes it.  Willow accepts it. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's inside? Madmartigan sticks his finger in his mouth and pries it open as wide as possible. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tooth. (Willow reacts)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm strving.  I got no used for it. Noise in the distance.  up the road Willow sees a MESSENGER charging on horseback.  He gallops right past, whipping his horse, almost knocking Willow off the road.  Then another MESSENGER follows with the same urgency.  Willow grabs the baby and steps out to stop him. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop!  Wait! The messenger screams a Willow who jumps aside as he thunders by.  The two horsemen disappear up the road. MADMARTIGAN (with authority)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smells like a battle. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you a warrior? MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The greatest swordsman that ever lived. Madmartigan slices the air with an imaginary sword. Willow shakes his head and goes back to the baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE SEE the empty road.  Willow's head pops INTO FRAME. He grabs the baby. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?  I hear something! MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hear trouble. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it? The horizon rumbles.  Madmartigan cups his ear.  Cyni- cally: MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hundred horses...five or six wagons...  and about six thousand fools. Two CAVALRY OFFICERS gallop into view, raising a plume of dust.  Then an enormous ARMY appears:  cavalry, foot soldiers, assault wagons: shields, swords, spears, raised banners. The two officers shout orders over the thunderous clamor of hoofbeats, marching boots and clanking armor. Charging back and forth, they shepherd the army through the crossroads.  Willow holds the baby.  Fighting dust and noise he tries to get the officer's attention. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir?  Sir! OFFICER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of the way! An officer's horse nearly kicks Willow, who scurries out of the way.  Huddling with the baby, he notices AIRK THAUGHBAER, a large, muscular, bearded officer, clearly in charge.  On horseback, Airk breaks file and rides up to the other officers. AIRK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Push 'em harder!  No rest at mid- day!  We need to make ten more leagues by dark! Shouting orders, the officers split up, charging to the front and rear of the army.  Airk watches the army pass.  Willow desperately scrambles up to him. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir!  Sir!  I have this baby.  We found her in our village.  Will you take her...? Huge Airk looks down from his huge horse.  Little Wil- low holds up the baby. AIRK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going into battle, little one.  Find a woman to take care of it. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He thought you were a woman, Airk! Airk snaps hes head around and his eyes flash. AIRK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madmartigan!  What did you do this time? MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing you wouldn't have done it my place! Airk's horse prances menacingly around Madmartigan's cage. AIRK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always knew you'd end up in a crow's cage. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Least I'm not down there herding sheep! Airk laughs sourly and rocks the cage. AIRK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're lucky somebody got to you first, Madmartigan!  I'd've killed you myself after that stunt at Land's End! He swings that cage and starts to ride away. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Airk!  Come on, Airk.  Lemme outa here. AIRK (really sarcastic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, remember?  You don't need my help, Madmartigan.  Little rabbit trap like this?  Come on!  I could open it for you, but I wouldn't wanna insult you! MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme a sword, Airk.  I'll win your war for you. Airk quickly drops the banter and glares at Madmartigan s ously. AIRK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're nothing but trouble, Madmar- tigan.  And I got plenty of that. Stay in your coffin and rot! Airk spurs his horse and smashes the cage as he charges off. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be around long after you're dead, Airk!  You slime!  When I get outa here I'll cut your head off and stick it on a pig-pole! WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Friend of yours? Madmartigan snarls down at Willow as the army continues to march by.  But then he quickly gets cute again. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, little baby...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ghostly wind hants the barren crossroads.  The road is pocked with hoofprints and wagon tracks.  Willow shakes his head at the ashes of his dead fire. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatcha thinkin' about, Willow? WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate this. Madmartigan squeezes his face between the bars of his cage. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody's gonna take your baby. Know why?  Nobody cares... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except me. (wistfully)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna go back to your farm. You wanna go back to your family. I could take care of that baby. I'll look after her like she was me own. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know anything about ba- bies. Madmartigan kneels and straightens up and points up his finger astutely. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhh!  But I know a lot of women who do.  Why, if I had somebody in my life--a little daughter for instance--I'd have a reason to live... He clsps his hands together outside the bars, plead- ing: MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willow.  You can't let me die here. Not when I wanna help you. Willow looks at the baby in the porta-crib.  Then looks up the empty road.  Then looks hard at Madmartigan. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta promise to feed her. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fresh goat's milk. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely! Willow draws his dagger and begins to hack at the chain. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And give her a bath everyday, and don't let her get cold.  And keep her diaper changed. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course!  I promise! Willow hacks and pries at the chain until it breaks open.  The bottom of the cage falls out, dumping Mad- martigan into a heap of rags and dust. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come to Daddy, little darlin'. (picks her up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think she likes me! Kneeling on the ground, he plays with the baby.  Willow quickly hitches the papoose to Madmartigan's back and hands him supplies. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here are her diaper rags.  And this is her milk bladder.  And when she cries--she's either hungry or she's tired--rock her on your left shoulder.  She likes that. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, Willow.  She's in good hands.  You haven't made a mistake. Willow takes the baby and kisses her. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye. He puts her in the papoose. WILLOW (to Madmartigan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please take good care of her. Madmartigan stands up.  He towers above Willow.  He pats Willow on the head. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've done a great job.  Now you go back to your family and get your crop in. Madmartigan smiles, turns, and marches off down the road.  Willow sighs with relief, his task accomplished. He watches Madmartigan and the baby disappear over a hill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swinging his arms and whistling a tune, Willow struts proudly up a gentle hill. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, it's Willow Ufgood!  He's come home!  Welcome back, Willow! He deserves a medal:  he's quite mystical.  For honor, for bravery, for his intuitive powers... (he chuckles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...let's make him Apprentice Aldwin.  Better still:  High Aldwin!  Make way!  It's Willow Uf- good, High Aldwin of--- The baby cries!  Willow spins around.  Flying towrd him is an incredible VULTURE with enormous winds.  In its claws it carries the baby, papoose and all.  It swoops straight at Willow, buzzing him, and Willow hits the dirt.  He looks up.  To add to the wonder:  riding the vulutre is an ELF. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come back here, you!  That's my baby!! The vulture zooms off into the tall majestic trees of the forest, with the baby crying.  Shouting and waving madly, Willow gallops after it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willow tears after the vulture which vanishes in the towering trees.  As the path narrows, something whis- tlse past his ear.  Finger-length arrows rain down on him from every direction, peppering the surrounding trees.  Some even hit Willow.  He plucks them out as he races along. He comes to a fork in the path:  Decision!  He starts down one way, then slams on the brakes.  He sees ropes and nets. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no, it's a trap! He hurries back to the fork and takes the safer route-- WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh noooooo!! --and gets swallowed by a deadly pit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willow wakes up as a pail of water hits him in the face.  His feet and wrists are being bound.  Several little ELVES are gawking and laughing at him.  They wear samurai-type outfits and angry little haircuts. WILLOW (focusing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where am I?  Where's the baby? FRANJEAN, the Elfin king, struts forward arrogantly. He speaks a haughty, nasal accent resembling French: FRANJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am Franjean, king of the world. Willow struggles against the ropes that bind him. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That baby's my responsibility! Outraged, Franjean smacks Willow's nose with the back of his hand. FRANJEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care.  We paid for her.  Go back to sleep, monsieur... As he leaves, Franjean nods to an intense-looking ARCH- ER elf heavily armed with arrows and a spear.  The archer dips his spear in a bowl of purple liquid.  He pricks Willow's arm. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeow! (he loses consciousness) Madmartigan...I never should've trusted you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willow's eyes open.  A wild little face is looking at him.  A wild little person is standing on his chest. TEEMO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tongue. Too groggy to argue, Willow sticks out his tongue. TEEMO the brownie crushes a brittle leaf and tosses the dust into Willow's mouth.  Smacking his lips, Willow comes around.  He sees, down between his legs, another brownie named ROOL cutting the ropes. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you? ROOL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet, you fool! TEEMO (formal)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are emissaries of her majesty, Queen Cherlindrea, of the land of Coshairm. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Queen Cherlindrea? TEEMO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She requests the presence of your- self and the young princess. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?? TEEMO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the guardian, aren't you? ROOL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quit yakking, Teemo.  We gotta get outa here! Willow rolls onto his knees, stands up and bumps his head on the ceiling.  The fuzzy-headed brownies creak open the door and becon Willow to follow.  He squeezes through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like a rabbit warren, compartments branch off the main tunnel.  Willow scrunches along behind the tip-toeing brownies.  They hear the baby crying.  They peek through the door. Inside a cluttered room they see thebaby crying miser- ably.  Her tears are being carried to a high level in tiny buckets on a mechanized wheel, operated by FOUR ELVES. TEEMO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elves!  They're always tormenting babies.  They make them cry and take their tears. ROOL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody has to do it. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?? ROOL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How else they gonna make dew drops? The baby shrieks. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm getting her out of there! TEEMO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  You let us handle this.  Come along, Rool! Teemo ridiculously pushes Willow away from the door. With a macho swagger he adjusts his dagger belt, and he and Rool open the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter like gunslingers in a saloon.  The four elves, who are twice their size, turn and face them. Teemo draws his small dagger.  With confidence he smiles at Rool. TEEMO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch this.  Right between the eyes. ROOL (to the elves)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He never misses. Artfully Teemo poises the dagger above his head.  With all his might he throws.  His dagger flip-flops through the air and lands at the elves' feet, plink-plunk. TEEMO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooops.  Was that right?  That wasn't right. Suddenly the entire wall implodes.  The elves scream and panic as Willow comes crashing in like King Kong. He grabs the crying baby and tucks her under his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The brownies scamper out of a hole in the ground where the elves keep their vultures corralled. ROOL/TEEMO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hyah!  Hyah!  Git! They untie th evulture and send them flapping away in the forest as Willow wiggles out of the elf hole with the baby.  They run for their lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rool and teemo tear along at incredible speed, Willow barely keeping up with them.  Little elf arrows shower the forest as the angry elves chase after them, whoop- ing and screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They skid up to a perilously deep drop into oblivion. The elves are shrieking toward them. The only chance of excape is a huge fallen tree spanning the gorge. The brownies scamper out.  Willow looks down and reels with vertigo. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't go out there with the baby! ROOL/TEEMO (frantically point)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elves!! The elf army pours out of the forest.  Willow holds his breath and ventures out onto the topmost branches of the tree.  Arrows zing around him as he wobbles like a drunken tightrope walker toward the middle.  The brown- ies wait for him. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohhh, I hate this. TEEMO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take your time.  Don't worry about the elves.  They won't come out here. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? ROOL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because of the trolls. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trolls? The brownies console Willow with unworried laughter. TEEMO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax.  They only come out at night. An ugly TROLL snarls up behind Willow.  They all scream and race for the other side.  Another TROLL pops up to meet them.  The trolls slink along like possums.  The brownies dive through a hole in the hollow tree trunk. The elves, meanwhile, flint-start a fire at their end of the tree.  One troll claws at the brownies inside the trunk while the other chases Willow across gangling branches.  Then the baby falls out of the papoose!  She tumbles and catches on a low branch and Willow races the troll and grabs her just before she plummets into the gorge. One troll catches Rool but can't then get his claw out of the trunk.  The brownies finally excape.  The tree burns and breaks, dangling over the gorge by its roots. A troll howls as he falls to his death.  The other scrambles up the tree and grabs Willow's foot. Willow's boot slips off and down goes the second troll. Flames lick at Willow as he at last hauls himself to safety, just as the roots snap and the blazing tree goes crashing down in the gorge. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not going well. TEEMO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry!  Queen Cherlindrea will know what to do. Willow bundles the baby and follows the brownies into the forest.  Hobbling slightly on his bootless foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fading sunlight bleeds through awesomely beautiful trees as Willow and the brownies trek into the magical Fairy Kingdom.  Elora Danan falls into a peaceful sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willow comes to a halt.  His mouth drops open.  The forest is a luminous Milky Way of dancing, flying FAIRIES, like fireflies.  The brownies tug at his pant-legs and whisper. TEEMO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.  This is a privilege.  No- body ever gets called before Her Majesty. Wonder-struck, Willow walks into a clearing where colorful night-flowers bloom.  He lowers himself onto an enormous toadstool, testing it with his hand.  Other BROWNIES stand watching, like courtiers.  The tiny fairies fly up to Willow's face and giggle:  they look like five-year-old girls, full of mischief and fun. Suddenly a strange LIGHT begins to throb behind the trees, peircing the forest with helter-skelter beams. Willow throws up his arms as the bright light stings his eyes. ROOL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stand up!  It's the queen! CHERLINDREA, the Fairy Queen, materializes out of frag- ments of moving light, diaphanous, sylph-like, beauti- ful. CHERLINDREA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willow Ufgood. WILLOW (blinded)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes...? CHERLINDREA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope you are comfortable here, inside my kingdom... Willow says nothing, still batling the bright light. TEEMO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk!  Say something! WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't see anything--she's too bright! CHERLINDREA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry... The light diminishes, enabling Willow to see the queen. She is a beautiful vision, with flowing hair and lumi- nous eyes.  Her magical presence both stuns and impresses Willow.  She turns to the brownies. CHERLINDREA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Broke-heart of nightingale for our honored guest. All the courtier brownies snap to attention and go into action, bustling about, going to work, some even trip- ping over one another.  They bring Willow a drink in a delicate cup-shaped leaf, and he takes a sip. The queen dissolves and reappears near Willow.  She le- ans down and opens the baby's swaddling and looks at the mark on the baby's arm. CHERLINDREA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is Elora Danan!  The prophecy has come true. The tiny fairies and the brownies stop work and sigh with respect and amazement.  Cherlindrea seems to levi- tate the baby out of Willow's arms, floating her magi- cally onto a special cradle of stram and sticks.  The brownies and fairies crowd around, with great rever- ence. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean, you know who this baby belongs to? CHERLINDREA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She belongs to all of us.  She is the future queen and ruler of all kingdoms on earth. Willow starts to get up. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a relief.  Now I can go home. The queen fragments and reappears right in front of Willow. CHERLINDREA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Willow.  Your journey has just begun.  It has been foretold that this child shall bring about the downfall of Queen Bavmorda, whose evil powers have darkened our world.  Upon you depends this princess's life. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me? The Fairy Queen flashes and vanishes.  Willow lowers himself back down again.  She reappears behind him. CHERLINDREA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are the guardian, Willow.  You must take her to Tir Asleen. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is Tir Asleen? Willow can't keep track of her.  She keeps changing her shape.  The brownies and fairies snicker at Willow's confusion. CHERLINDREA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a distant castle, where a great king and queen will look after Elora Danan and keep her safe until she is old enough to rule. She is gone again.  Willow looks everywhere, frusturated by these riddles and mysteries. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is Tir Asleen?  How far is it? She reappears again. CHERLINDREA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The way has been lost in time. But there is one person, a druid sor- ceress, who might guide you there. She was exiled by Queen Bavmorda many years ago.  Her name is Fin Raziel. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need a warrior for this job. I'm nobody. CHERLINDREA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are very important, Willow. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No I'm not.  Have you really looked at me? (jumps to his feet)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm short!  Even for a Nelwyn! From down at his feet, Rool and Teemo stare up, insult- ed. WILLOW (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why can't you do it?  You have mag- ical powers. CHERLINDREA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My prsence cannot extend beyond this forest.  But I can give you these... Cherlindrea drops three small objects in Willow's hand. CHERLINDREA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They will protect you.  Use them wisely. Willow looks at them for quite a while. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look like acorns. CHERLINDREA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything you hurl them at will turn to stone. Willow looks closely at the acorns, then up at the queen. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're magic?  Are you serious? The forest light grows brighter.  The queen looms over Willow and he again has to shield himself from the brightness. CHERLINDREA (sternly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am very serious, Willow.  There is no time to lose. Now she intensifies her light so that Willow backs away, completely covering his face. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I've got a family to think about!  They need me! The queen swirls around him like a solar wind, blowing the forest trees, scaring even the brownies.  And then all of a sudden:  silence.  And total darkness.  ALL WE SEE, in dim moonlight, is Willow's face, peeking out from between his fingers. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello...? The queen's voice echoes the forest. CHERLINDREA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bavmord'a powers are growing like an evil plague.  Soon she will con- trol the lives of you children, your wife, your village...everyone. Very gradually and beautifully the firey fairies begin to flicker, restoring light to the forest.  More light genlty brightens, bathing the woods, and the Fairy Queen reappears.  She is holding Elora Danan in her arms.  The brownies creep out from behind the trees. All eyes are upon Willow. CHERLINDREA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The choice is yours. Willow takes the baby and looks at her for a moment. He struggles with his conscience.  The fairies and brownies wait in anticipation.  At last Willow looks up at them, resolved and determined. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do it.  Yes, I will, I'll do it! The fairy kingdom sends up a great cheer and applause. Fairies giggle playfully around Willow's face, and brownies hug his ankles. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I only have one shoe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE SEE Willow's feet as he walks along.  He has himself a brand-new shoe. Spirits high, he treks in the sunshine, papoose strapped to his back.  Teemo rides in his pocket, while Rool straddles the papoose, tickling the giggling baby. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait till I tell my children. Stuff like this never happens in my village. He digs a magic acorn out of his pocket and tosses it high in the air.  The brownies gasp. TEEMO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, careful there! WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do these work I wonder?  I got- ta save one to show the High Aldwin. ROOL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look!  Death below! Rool points through the trees.  Willow hurries down the hill to the tree-line.  In the valley below, 200 NOCK- MAAR SOLDIERS and CALVALRYMEN battle a hundred ragtag REBEL TROOPS.  From this sage position high on the hillside, Willow watches in disgust.  Weapons clash and men fall to their deaths. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daikinis... They hear a CLANK behind them.  Willow slowly turns around.  There is movement in the trees.  The hillside woods are full of Nockmaar HORSEMEN moving right up next In the valley, the oupowered rebels are being forced up the hill toward them.  Willow is suddenly standing under several large horses and black-armored minions. He is frozen in fear. HORSEMEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hyaaaaahh!! Swords flash and the horseman charge!  The brownies jump and run for their lives.  Willow stumbles and spins as horse after horse thunders past him, nearly trampling him and the baby to death. The Nockmaar reinforcements descend upon the remaining rebels and crush them.  Willow falls and quickly digs the baby out of the papoose.  She is shrieking in ter- ror.  He holds her tight and runs along the tree-line, following the brownies, while the bloody battle rages below. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get out of here.  Shhh, don't cry, Elora.  Things can't get any worse than this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bleak rain dribbles down Willow's miserable face.  Pro- tecting the baby, he hurries toward a tavern.  The bot- tom of the building is an open stable with several horses.  Two burly IRON-WORKERS clank a red-hot wagon rim, fixing a nearby wagon hitched to a horse. It's a rough place.  Rool and Teemo peek out of Willow's pockets.  Upstairs PEOPLE drink and shout. TEEMO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going in there. ROOL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me neither! WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry--I'm a sorcerer.  What could possibly happen? Suddenly there's a CRASH up above and two PICTS burst through a balcony and land in the mud, fighting vi- ciously.  Rool and Teemo duck inside Willow's pockets. Willow steps around the Picts, dashes through the stable and up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is packed with tattooed PICTS, nomadic FAMI- LIES, MOTHERS wit BABIES, THIEVES and CUTTHROATS. Willow enters with the crying baby. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you spare some milk for this poor hungry baby? Everyone looks up.  Mopping a table is an ugly BARMAID as big as a wrestler. BARMAID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get outa here, Peck! PATRONS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Peck!  Get him out!  Beat it, Peck! They hurl stuff at him and threaten him with their weapons.  Willow runs along the wall and takes cover under some stairs.  He pulls open his pocket and peers down inside. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could use your help, boys. Instantly his pocket whips shut and trembles.  Willow cautiously looks out under the stairs.  He sees a pail of milk very near some ROUGHNECKS.  Willow puts his little finger in the baby's mouth, silencing her.  He creeps out.  And bravely reaches for the milk. TEEMO'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willow? Willow slaps his pocket.  Then stretches his arm out very, very slowly.  And gets the pail and zips back under the stairs. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not fun. He soaks a rag with milk and feeds the baby.  Catching his breath, he backs up and leans agains a woodplank wall. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woah! The plank gives way and Willow falls through the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willow somersaults into a bedroom near an unmade bed. Peeking up he sees two women getting dressed in a pan- ic.  One is a plump-chested WENCH with a pretty face. WENCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry!  Hurry! Very frightened, she looks out the window.  The other woman, who wears a kerchief over her hair, packs thick powder and make-up paint on her face. THE OTHER WOMAN (in a gruff voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do I look? It's Madmartigan!  Willow pops up like a jack-in-the- box. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You!! MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell did you come from? Willow strides toward Madmartigan, holding the baby like a machine gun. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I trusted you... The brownies peek out. ROOL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's he? MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're crawling with rodents. The bedroom door explodes open.  In storms a big, mean, half-drunk raging lug named LLUG. LLUG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he!! Madmartigan wraps a muffler around his throat.  The wench innocently curtsies. WENCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nobody here except me and my, um, cousin. Llug knocks his wife out of the way and glares susi- ciously at Madmartigan, who bats his heavily made-up eyelashes.  He speaks in a high feminine voice. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you do. Llug sniffs at Madmartigan then fixes his gaze on Madmartigan's flat chest.  He goes to squeeze him there, but Madmartigan ducks out of the way and snatches the baby from Willow. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  Give me that baby! MADMARTIGAN (high voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These Pecks make terrible nurse- maids. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nursemaid?! Willow angrily jumps up and down, swiping at the baby. MADMARTIGAN (high voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They get too excited. With a swing of the hip, Madmartigan butts Willow aside and maternally puts the baby against his chest.  Llug houd-dogs him around the room, finally cornering him and staaring lecherously into his eyes. LLUG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna breeeeeeed? Madmartigan protects himself by holding the baby up in front of his face.  Then he smells the baby.  He winces and groans. WILLOW (mischievously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time to change her diaper. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time to leave. Madmartigan throws open the door and dashes out.  But he doesn't get very far.  Several NOCKMAAR SOLDIERS push him back in.  Then they grab madmartigan and Wil- low, and Llug and his wife, and haul them all outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madmartigan is slammed against a wall.  The Willow. Then Llug and his wife.  In the b.g. Nockmaar troops are rousting the tavern, taking babies away from frightened mothers and inspecting them. Heavy bootsteps thud toward them.  Willow looks out and recognizes Sorsha, the black-helmeted knight from the bridge. SORSHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You!  Are you the mother of that child? MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. (looks at Llug; in a high voice) I mean yes. Sorsha strides over to Madmartigan, her sword drawn. SORSHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me see it. Madmartigan looks at Willow then back at Sorsha. MADMARTIGAN (high voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't. SORSHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me see it. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  You can't! Madmartigan looks at Willow then back at Sorsha. MADMARTIGAN (high voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't. SORSHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? MADMARTIGAN (to Willow)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because she's sick. MADMARTIGAN (to Sorsha)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because she's sick. SORSHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it to me! Sorsha stabs her sword into the floor like a spike. She grabs for the baby.  Instinctively, Madmartigan el- bows her away, whacking her hard and knocking her off- balance against a nearby bench.  The soldiers tense up, pointing their swords and spears. Sorsha regains her balance.  She rips off her black helmet.  Long wild red hair tumbles over her shoulders. She is a young woman, and Madmartigan's eyes pop open. He does his best to keep up his femal facade. MADMARTIGAN (high voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gawd...you're...beautiful... SORSHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not a woman. Sorsha comes right up to Madmartigan, squinting into his eyes.  The she rips away his kerchief and muffler. LLUG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a woman                        ! All hell breaks loose.  Llug charges for Madmartigan's throat.  Madmartigna tucks the baby under his arm and dashes right out the window.  Llug bulldozes Sorsha and her Lieutenant, and the tavern patrons take advantage of the chaos and stampede for the stairs.  Willow dives out the window after Madmartigan. SORSHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After them!! She grabs her sword and waves it at her soldiers who clatter toward the stairs, flinging people out of their way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madmartigna jumps off the upstairs balcony and lands in the wagon below.  The two iron-workers look up with concern.  Then they react with surprise as Madmartigan rips away his disguise. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madmartigan!  Wait! Up above, Willow charges along the balcony.  Madmarti- gan juggles the baby and whips the reins.  The wagon pulls away, iron-workers scrambling after it.  Willow flings himself off the balcony.  The brownies tumble out of his pocket.  They all land in the back of the wagon as it takes off. It has stopped raining.  In the stable under the tavern, horses smash together and people fall in the mud, and the Nockmaar soldiers get tangled up in the traffic jam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Madmartigan lashes the horse, Willow crawls up to hum and takes the baby. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could've been killed, Madmarti- gan! In the back, the brownies boucne all over the place amid wooden kegs and other objects.  When they finally get their balane they look back in alarm. Chasing them are two Nockmaar HORSEMEN plus a DEATH DOG and a war chariot. Willow ducks low and peeks out, protectively hugging the baby.  The wagon bounces and flies along, but the minions are quickly gaining.  Rool and Teemo spring into action.  They struggle with all their might and manage to kck small wooden kegs off the back of the wagon. The kegs bounce onto the road, and the minions lose some ground trying to avoid them.  But soon the horse- men flank the wagon.  One leaps off his galloping horse and climbs on board.  The other draws an arrow and gets ready to fire. Madmartigan is about to be shot between the eyes.  He quickly rolls into the back.  The archer firse! and hits the other minion in the chest.  Madmartigna snaps a wooden stake off the wagon side and smashes the wounded minion off the wagon:  he crashes onto the road. Willow harnesses the papoose to his chest and grabs the reins.  At the same time the minion archer leaps aboard.  He and Madmartigan fight in the back. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heeyah!  Heeyah! Then there's a terrible howl right beside Willow.  The Death Dog is leaping alongside the wagon, gnashing and trying to board.  Willow yanks the reins and swerves the wagon into the dog, which yelps furiously.  In the back, Madmartigan and the minion are thrown by the swerving jolt. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no! Up ahead Willow sees an exposed tree root in the road. The wagon is headed straight for it!  The wheel hits the root hard and Willow is dumped onto the wagon floor and very nearly goes overboard. In the back, Madmartigan and the minion keep fighting as the wagon clatter along out of control.  The Death Dog catches up again and this time spring aboard. DEATH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bordak!! The dog snaps at the baby.  Willow scurries under the wagon seat.  The dog stands up on its hind feet. DEATH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bordak!! It gets ready to attack.  But WHACK! an overhanging tree branch hits it and Willow looks up from under the seat and sees the mangled dog twitching and dangling from the tree, rapidly disappearing in the distance. In the back, meanwhile, the minion draws a knife.  Mad- martigan ducks out of his way, hanging onto a post at the edge of the tailgate.  The minion comes after him. Suddenly the wagon wheel wobbles and the rim flies off. The jolt throws the minion off balance.  Madmartigan kicks him.  The minion hurtles off the taligate but holds on, dragged by the wagon. Rool and Teemo grab hold of a rope securing a large wooden keg.  Together they yank it.  Untying the keg and sending it tumbling off the back.  The minion looks up in horror as the heavy keg crushes him. But the danger is far from over.  The wagon rocks along with one wheel half-destroyed.  Willow whips the reins and looks over his shoulder.  Steam-rolling toward them is the war chariot! The Nockmaar CHARIOT DRIVER stands up and stuffs the reins in his mouth.  He rasise his arm and begins to twirl a deadly weapon, a kind of bolo-blade, over his head. Madmartigan defends himself with a wooden wagon-post. The chariot driver hurls the whistling blade:  CHONK! It lodges in the post.  Madmartigan tugs.  So does the chariot driver.  Back and forth, the wagons smashing up each other.  At last Madmartigan lets go of the post and the chariot driver is sent tumbling through the airl, over a cliff to his death. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woah...woah...! Willow tries to stop the horse.  But the wheel col- lapses and he is thrown off into a ditch.  The brownies dive overboard.  Madmartigan jumps off and delibrerately sends the wagon up the road.  He scrambles down into the ditch and lies flat beside Willow. Suddenly, hoofbeats thunder and Sorsha and the rest of her troops gallop past.  Lying flat, Madmartigna raises his head and sees Sorsha's long flowing red hair. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That girl is a vision. As soon as the troops are gone, Willow jumps up. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the baby?? MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you had her! ROOL/TEEMO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willow!! The brownies are waving and gesturing madly, pointing at a heap of boards and rubble that broke off the wagon.  Willow and Madmartigan race over and start dig- ging, flinging debris aside. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Willow, I know you're gonna blame me for this but it wasn't my fault...! WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
