dialogues.text: Elora Danan! Willow sees the battered, lifeless papoose.  He grabs it and rips it open.  Madmartigan kneels in the dirt remorsefully. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I left the crossroads, I got ambushed by an elf! WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madmartigan!  You saved her life! MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did? Willow holds up the baby.  She giggles and smiles. Madmartigan switches gears, boasting: MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, of course I saved her life. She's almost my daughter, isn't she? Willow bundles the baby and looks up the road. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get out of here before they come back. They hurry off into the darkening woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A campfire blazes.  Willow tends the baby while the brownies point up at the stars. TEEMO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Northeast is that way.  We've come west and south.  I think. Madmartigan dumps a big log on the fire, spraying the brownies with sparks. ROOL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch it!  You're gonna set us on  fire. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a bad idea. Madmartigan terrorizes them with a flaming stick.  Then he squats beside Willow and the baby. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're on your way to Tir Asleen, huh?  I hate to tell you this, Willow, but Tir Asleen dosn't exist. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes it does.  The Fairy Queen told me. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Fairy Queen?  And the baby here's a princess?  And these two rodents are your guides? He shakes his head sceptically, stretches out and puts his feet up on a log. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah well...in the morning I think I'll be on my way. He laughs sarcastically.  Willow sets down the baby.  He takes off Kiaya's necklace and fingers it sadly. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madmartigan, I need your help. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My help?  A great magician like you?  You don't need any help. Willow stares at him angrily. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you're a great swordsman! He jumps and starts pacing around the fire.  Rool and Teemo dive for cover. WILLOW (explodes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not a warrior, Madmartigan! A warrior wouldn't lie there and do nothing! He kicks Madmartigan's boot and knocks his feet off the log. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in trouble!  You've seen the big army that's after us!  You're a fake!  You're a bum!  You're a-- you're a coward!! He picks up a rock and pitches it wildly at the fire, sending up a shower of sparks.  Madmartigan eyes him with concern. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's with you, Peck? Willow lets it all pour out.  He begins to cry. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I miss my wife!  I miss my chil- dren!  My boy Ranon!  He's growing up so fast, he even helps me on the farm now!  And little Mims!  If you ever saw her sweet little face you'd *melt* Madmartigan, you'd *melt*! (sniffles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or maybe you wouldn't.  You don't know anything about love.  You don't know anything about any- thing... Willow sits on the ground, exhausted.  Madmartigan picks up the baby and sits with her in his lap. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was in love once, Willow.  She had a hold on my heart.  I could barely function. (a pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I *was* a great swordsman!  I was knighted!  I could have been king! WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You? MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah me.  King!  But she betrayed me.  She robbed me of my dream. Madmartigan gently rocks the baby and stares at the fire.  Willow watches him curiously. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll never fall in love again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willow wakes up and looks around.  The baby is gone. He panics.  He scrambles a short distance through some bushes. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madmartigan!  Madmartigan! They've been camped all night near the shore of a LAKE. Willow finds Madmartigan and the baby bathing happily in the water. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax, Willow.  We're having fun. The baby squeals with delight as Madmartigan twirls her around.  He lifts her yp and carries her to Willow on the shore.  The brownies crawl thorugh the bushes. Rool points out at the lake. ROOL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it!  The sorceress lives there! In the middle of the lake is an island with a single tree. TEEMO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure? ROOL (excited)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!  Raziel!  She lives out on that island! Madmartigan lets out a sarcastic, sceptical laugh. Teemo scratches his head and squints out at the island. TEEMO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That tree dosn't look like gold to me. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gold!! Madmartigan rubs his chin with sudden interest. TEEMO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Its branches are supposed to be made of gold, solid gold. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are we going to get out there? Madmartigan is suddenly pacing and thinking. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll find a way, Willow.  Look over there--that looks like a village--maybe they've got a boat. Come on, what are you waiting for? Madmartigan runs along the shore toward a small village in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half a dozen decrepit huts sit rotting on the edge of the lake.  There are no inhabitants, just a lot of dis- carded junk, including a few battered fishing boats. But Madmartigan, keeping one eye on the gold tree out on the island, is undaunted.  He rummages through the debris, hauling out a fishing boat and shouldering it toward the water. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me a hand here, Peck! Willow hoists the baby into the papoose and helps Mad- martigan. BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? They turn around.  A golden-haired BOY is standing waist-deep in th elake.  Madmartigan is instantly wary of him. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nothing to do with you. But the boy looks innocent and harmless, and Willow ap- proaches him. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to get out to that island. BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The island is cursed. Madmartigan scoffs at this nonsense, grunting and push- ing the boat into the water. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've traveled a long way.  We're looking for Fin Raziel. TEEMO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sorceress. BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's there.  But you can't go there.  The island is cursed. MADMARTIGAN (no patience)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?  Who cursed it? BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Queen Bavmorda.  Her powers govern the elements. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahh, he's trying to protect the gold.  Come on, Willow.  Jump in. Madmartigan climbs into the boat and grabs an oar, eager to go.  Willow looks down at the brownies for help. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would the Fairy Queen say? ROOL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not here. TEEMO (to Rool)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Obviously. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without Raziel we'll never find Tir Asleen. (decision)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd better go. Willow marches to the boat.  Calmly accepting their choice, the golden-haired boy dives into the lake and disappears.  Willow and the brownies board the boat, and Madmartigan poles them away from the shore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They row across the placid lake toward the island.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They climb onto the rocky shore.  Flies buzz and swarm around them, and creepy bugs crawl around their feet. Broken skeletons litter the shore.  Handing the baby back and forth, Willow and Madmartigan claw their way up to the large tree. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raziel?  Hello?  Fin Raziel? Madmartigan greedily reaches up to touch a branch. RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get away!  Get away! A littel animal scurries down the tree and hisses vi- ciously at Madmartigan, chattering its teeth. RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll die!  You'll die! RAZIEL scampers over to Willow.  Her voice screeches like a parrot.  She looks like an otter with a bush tail. RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you!  Who are you! WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Willow Ufgood.  I'm here to find Fin Raziel. She springs right onto Willow's chest. RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's me!  Raziel!  Raziel! Willow looks down at the browines questioninghly. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This can't be right.  This isn't a sorceress.  This is some kind of animal. TEEMO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Queen Bavmorda transformed her. RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want! WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need your help.  To take this baby to Tir Asleen.  She's a prin- cess. Still sceptical, Willow shows Raziel the baby's mark. Raziel shoots up onto a branch and frantically flicks her tail. RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elora Danan! Madmartigan snaps a branch off the tree.  A flock of birds suddenly screech and fly away.  His eyes bulge. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rool!  Teemo!  You were right! This whole tree is made of gold!! He strips away the bark, revealing a vein of gold. RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fools!  You should never have come to this place!  We're all going to die! The wind begins to blow and the sky darkens.  Raziel zips over to Willow and whispers intensely. RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got to get off this island right now.  Hurry!  The boat!  It's our only chance! The wind howls.  they hurry down to the boat. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madmartigan! Madmartigan is greedily breaking branches off the tree. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait!  Gold!  Gold! Waves lash at the boat as they jump aboard.  Madmarti- gan loads up with branches.  As they push off, he scrambles down the rocks.  Just in time he jumps into the boat as the storm swirls it out into the frothy lake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willow clutches the baby as the raging storm pitches the boat. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help, Madmartigan!  The oar! Madmartigan hangs onto his gold, but pices of it drop and topple overboard. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My gold! Suddenly a hand appears on the stern.  The water boy climbs in. RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill him! WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill him! Madmartigna hesitates but then smashes the boy back into the lake.  The boy surfaces like a dolphin.  His shape begins to change, becoming fish-like, diving and vanishing. Then:  he attacks the boat!  He is now a ferocious shark-like monster.  He chomps the boat and the gold branches slide into the water.  Madmartigan bashes the monster with the oar, then grabs an anchor.  The mon- ster attacks again and Madmartigan jabs its gill with the anchor. The monster sinks into the lake.  They all sigh with relief.  Madmartigan shrugs proudly.  Suddenly the an- chor line unravels, tangling Madmartigan's legs in fishing nets and yanking him overboard. Underwater, Madmartigan swirls behind the monster.  He pulls himself along the anchor line and finally cuts himself free with his dagger. He surfaces and madly swims toward the pitching boat. Willow reaches out to him.  The monster surfaces and circles the boat.  Then it attacks Madmartigan. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!!  Help!!  Willow!!! Willow digs out a magic acorn.  But he drops it!  He fumbles in the leaking boat and finally finds it.  The monster opens its jaws and goes to devour Madmartigan. Willow throws the acorn. The monster miraculously turns to stone.  Madmartigan grabs the boat and watches in amazement as the monster sinks.  Willow hauls him into the boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The storm begins to die down as they jump to shore, ex- hausted.  Madmartigan wears nothing now but a ragged loincloth.  He falls to his knees, coughing and spit- ting. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willow...you...you got...magic...! Wait...we could team up...! He pulls himself up and follows Willow.  Suddenly they all stop.  Sorsha and her men come out of the woods. RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flee!  Flee! The brownies scurry into a hole.  Raziel makes a dash for it but a soldier skewers her tail with his spear, dangling her in front of Sorsha. SORSHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raziel.  Did you think my mother would allow you to escape? Sorsha gestures, and the soldier takes Raziel away. The lieutenant wrestles the baby away from Willow.  He gives her to Sorsha. SORSHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is what we're looking for.  It bears the markings. Willow panics. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, Willow.  If there's one thing I'm good at, it's charm- ing a woman... He swaggers forward.  Sorsha turns and looks at him. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So.  Couldn't live without me, huh? Sorsha looks up and down at his naked body. SORSHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lose your skirt?  How embarassing. Madmartigan looks down and adjusts his loincloth. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still got what counts. A pause as he smiles at her. SORSHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not for long. She raises her fist and zap:  Madmartigan is instantly surrounded by spears and swords. SORSHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll join the column.  Bring them with us. Madmartigan and Willow are roughly taken away.  Sorsha and her troops mount horses and ride off.  Rool and Teemo crawl lup from under a rock. TEEMO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta follow them. ROOL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Us??  We'll never catch them.  Any- way, we're all done, Teemo.  Let's go home. Rool walks off and Teemo grabs him, yanks him back. TEEMO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get back here, Rool! ROOL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ouch!  Let go of me! Rool throws a punch, and the brownies somersault into the bushes fighting each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorsha and her men now ride with a caravan of fifty NOCKMAAR TROOPS.  Chained by their necks.  Willow and Madmartigan walk behind a wagon.  Raziel sits trapped in a cage on the back of the wagon. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't go on... Willow loses strength, falls and is dragged.  Madmarti- gan picks him up and carries him on his shoulders. Sorsha sees this. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willow, why don't you use your mag- ic to get us out of here? RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's no magician. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turned that monster into stone! Raziel peers sternly at Willow, who is eye-level with her cage. RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did *you* give that acorn its power? WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A magician *makes* magic.  Any fool can use it. Madmartigan shakes his head at her. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you get us out of here. RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will!  But I need help! WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll help you...! MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't. RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must learn magic. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all I ever wanted! RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I will teach you. Sorsha rides up from the rear of the caravan, carrying the baby, who is crying.  Madmartigan, with Willow still on his shoulders, straightens up and flirts with her. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice horse...nice hair...real nice hair...I'd say you've got the most beautiful hair I've ever-- She flashes her eyes at him. SORSHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wolff wants to boil you in oil. She nods toward her Lieutenant, who snarls viciously. SORSHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tempt me. She turns away.  The baby squirms and cries. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you rest the baby on your shoulder, she'll stop crying. SORSHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up. Sorsha rides along.  She shifts the baby to her other shoulder, and she instantly stops crying.  Sorsha throws a look at Willow.  Madmartigan takes a long deep breath. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmmm, I love the smell of a woman. SORSHA (angry threat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My step-father's going to tear you apart. Madmartigan pounds his chest and taunts her: MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm torn apart already.  I mean it! Under all that armor is a  beautiful-- CRACK!  Sorsha whips her horse and gallops ahead. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is that girl, anyway? RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorsha, Queen Bavmorda's daughter. Madmartigan snaps his finger and discourages himself. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget that one, Madmartigan. Raziel leaps against the bars of her cage, chatters her teeth and whispers to Willow. RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willow.  To learn magic, first you  must make your own philosopher's stone! WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do I need for that? RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We must start with feathers, dung, and a lock of your hair. Willow pulls a strand of his hair out in front of his eyes and frowns at it.  Madmartigan, meanwhile, can't take his eyes off Sorsha. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that's a woman...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fires and torches burn around pitched tents.  Soldiers eat and drink, and meat is thrown out to Death Dogs. From her cage, Raziel looks down at Willow, still chained to the wagon next to Madmartigan.  Willow is grinding a substance with a rock. RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep working at it.  Forget all you know, or think you know.  A magician's power depends on disord- er of the mind. She twists her head through the bars.  Madmartigan squints up at her. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got that one covered. Willow hears the baby crying in a distant tent. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope she's all right.  How much more do I have to do of this? RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Till it's in a powder.  The energy exits within you... WILLOW (reciting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, and the magician's goal is to find his true self.  But what's this got to do with it? RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As below, so above.  You hold the univers, Willow, in your hand. Madmartigan clasps his forhead. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm beginning to think you two *deserve* to be locked up. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The universe is a living creature, like you and me, Madmartigan. Madmartigan cynically gazes at the sky, gesturing wide- ly. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're a tiny version of all that? RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As above, so below. Madmartigan rolls his eyes.  Willow jumps to his feet and shows Raziel the substance. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm all finished.  Now what? RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burn it to a fine ash. Willow looks around.  Heavily armed Nockmaar minions rip chunks of meat around a campfire. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How am I gonna do that? RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patience.  Concentrate.  You will find a way. Suddenly bootsteps clomp toward them.  Willow quickly folds the powder inside some cloth and hides it in his pocket.  The Lieutenant marches up and scrutinizes them suspiciously.  He abruptly snatches Willow up, hacks the chain and drags him off. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on? Madmartigan sturggles against his chains.  Angry and worried: MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurt him and you'll answer to me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lieutenant clamps irons on Willow's wrists, flings him into a tent and exits.  Willow looks up and sees Sorsha, still in her uniform, impatiently pacing wiht the crying baby. SORSHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This baby won't do what I say.  You seem to know what to do.  Here! Make it shut up. Sorsha dumps the baby in Willow's arms and then backs away. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She needs to be changed. SORSHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I changed her already! Willow politely shrugs. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She needs to be changed again. Sorsha crosses her arms in a hugg and watches as Willow changes the baby.  Soon the baby stops crying.  Re- lieved yet still anxious, Sorsha paces to a mirror. Willow rocks the baby gently, absently looking at the fire.  Then his eyes focus on the fire. SORSHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is that horrible friend of yours? WILLOW (watching the fire)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madmartigan. SORSHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is he? WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know much about him. Sorsha fiddles with her long red hair.  Willow creeps toward the fire. SORSHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's very bold.  Do you really think my hair is beautiful? She turns and looks right at Willow.  He looks back. She asks the question again by holding out strands of her hair. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, yes.  It's very nice hair. He suddenly strides over to Sorsha. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's hungry. SORSHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know she's hungry.  I tried to feed her but she wouldn't eat a thing.  I'm not a wet nurse. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.  Hold her. He hands Sorsha the baby, then goes to the fire where there's a stone crock of milk.  He carefully takes his cloth pouch out of his pocket and unfolds it.  At the other side of the tent Sorsha awkwardly paces with the baby. SORSHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tried everything.  A spoon.  I poured milk into her mouth, she just spat it out.  I don't know what to do, I'm not a mother. During this, Willow ignites his powdery substance.  It flares slightly then burns to an ash.  He gathers it up, then returns to Sorsha with the milk. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes she likes it heated. Willow finds a strip of cloth, dips it in the milk, and feeds Elora Danan in Sorsha's arms.  He looks up at Sorsha and smiles. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a good baby. Sorsha looks down at the baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The caravan packs up to move on.  Soldiers drag Willow to the wagon and lift him on board, chaining him beside Raziel's cage.  Willow excitedly pats his pocker, and whispers: WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did it!  I got the ashes! When the soldiers leave, he digs out the pouch and proudly shows it to Raziel. RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good!  The first step is complete. Chained behind the wagon, Madmartigan reaches forward and pokes Willow with his finger? MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did she ask about me? WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who? MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Peck, don't give me a hard time.  You were in her ten all night.  Did she say anything? Willow deliberately plays innocent. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She said lots of thing.s MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willow! Willow grins.  At last: WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She asked about you, Madmartigan. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well what did she say? Suddenly Sorsha gallops by on horseback, holding the baby.  She flings a wad of clothes at Madmartigan. SORSHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.  You're going to need these where we're going. She rides off.  Madmartigan looks down at the clothes. The looks at Willow. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's in love. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're crazy.  I think you're in love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Nockmaar caravan climbs into snow-covered moun- tains.  In the wagon, Raziel is grilling Willow.  He concentrates hard, cramming, memorizing, straining. RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have much time left!  Go on!  Go on! WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must concetrate my imagination...to creat a new...reality! RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the magician's weapon? WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The limitless power of... Raziel flips around in spasms of impatience. RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your will!  Your will!  What else could it be? WILLOW (frustrated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't remember all these things. What am I learning? RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The art of transformation! WILLOW (exasperated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what am I gonna transform?? RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me! Willow and Madmartigan stare at Raziel. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You? MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you gonna become, Raziel? Queen of the rodents? Sorsha rides up to the wagon. SORSHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The baby's cold.  Take her. She dismounts.  With care, keeping the baby bundled, she hands the baby to Willow.  Madmartigan watches and listens. RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remind me of your father, Sor- sha. SORSHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father was a weakling. RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was a great king. (Madmartigan reacts) Not like your step-father, not like your mother.  He ruled Tir Asleen with kindness, and a generous heart. SORSHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mother calls that weakness. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do *you* call it? Sorsha turns and glares at Madmartigan. SORSHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do what I'm told. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too bad you're not more like your father. She looks at him a moment, then abruptly mounts her horse and rides ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The caravan rides toward a large Nockmaar camp.  Death Dogs howl and fires burn ominously in the distance. Willow and madmartigan watch as KING KAEL rides out to meet the caravan. Kael is huge, powerful and cruel, partbeast, part man, and he carries a terrible sword at his side.  Sorsha carefully shows him the baby.  He grabs it from her. SORSHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be careful. KAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me what to do. Kael viciously hits Sorsha, knocking her off her horse. Madmartgian and Willow watch angrily.  Kail gallops to- ward camp with the baby under his ar.  Sorsha shakes away the pain and, humiliated, mounts her horse. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta get the baby out of here. Raziel dashes around her cage. RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight!  Complete the philosopher's stone!  I must be turned back! Looking off into the camp, angry and resolute, Willow takes out the ingredients for the stone. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do it, Raziel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now in a kind of portable cell, Madmartigan clutches the jail bars and looks out at the camp.  Fires and torches burn, and Nockmaar soldiers patrol. Shivering cold, willow sits cross-legged in the jail, melting snow into a bowl.  On a nearby lean-to, where skins and shields are kept, Raziel hangs in her cage. Somewhere the baby is crying.  In the distance Sorsha goes inside one of the tenst. There's a muffled yel- ling between Sorsha and Kael.  Then Keal storms out of the tent and goes inside the tent next door. Willow pours the ashes into the melted snow. RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let it settle.  Carefully, slowly. Concentration and will.  Now pour the water off. As Willow works, Madmartigan binds together scrap sticks of wood, making a long pole.  He gingerly hooks Raziel's cage with this, lifting it from the spike. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oooh, this smells terrible. RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the life spark.  Exxence of magic and sorcery! Madmartigan angles the pole and the cage slide toard him.  He grabs it with both hands and rips it apart. Raziel right away scurries down the cell bars, jumps into the jail and bits Willow's hand. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ouch!! RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhhhh! They look out nervously at patrolling Nockmaar sol- diers.  Willow sucks the back of his hand. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you bit me for!! RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need blood.  To nourish the stone.  charge the stone with ener- gy. Willow drips his blood into the concoction then stirs it with a twig.  It begins to glow from within. RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The components of the stone are fusing... Willow's eyes widen with anticipation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fires have burned down.  Most of the camp is sleeping. It is nearing dawn.  Madmartigan stares out at Sorsha's tent, deep in thought.  Willow holds up the completed PHILOSOPHER'S STONE, a red ball of pliable putty. RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again:  what is the magician's weapon? WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His will. RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now use it. Willow presses the philopher's stone against the chainlock.  He sheepishly looks over his hsoulder at Raziel. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanted to test it first. RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  Change me back into a sor- ceress, Willow. Willow goes to Raziel and concentrates with physical and mental intensity. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Avaggdu, supriom, luwatha... It starts to work.  Raziel curls into a ball of fur. The fur changes to feathers.  She begins to squawk strangely.  She emerges as a raven-sized bird. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did I do? He sags with exhaustion and massages his blistered hands.  Then: CLINK!  The lock falls open.  They all look over, and Madmartigan picks it up off the ground. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not bad, Peck.  I'm impressed.  You busted the lock. Wilow clutches Madmartigan's arm.  He holds up the stone. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madmartigan.  Let's go.  Let's get Eloran Danan. With coldness in his eyes, madmartigan stares across the camp at Sorsha's tent. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get Elora Danan. They sneak away. RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait!  What about me! Raziel flaps her wings and flies up into the dark sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willow and Madmartigan sneak behind tents, hiding from the patrolling guards.  Very quietly they creep up to Kael's tent.  Madmartigan knocks out a guard and steals his knife.  They crawl dangerously over to Sorsha's tent. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a magician, Willow.  But I'm a thief.  Wait here.  I'll get the baby. Madmartigan slits the back of the tent open and slips inside.  Raziel flutters down and lands on Willow's shoulder. RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm supposed to be a beautiful wo= man. Willow shrugs apologetically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crouched inside the large tent, Madmartigan calculates his next move.  In the far corner, Sorsha lies asleep. He steals the baby from a crib of straw.  Starts to leave.  But stops.  Willow pokes his head inside. WILLOW (whispers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Madmartigan...! Madmartigan stares over at Sorsha.  Lured by her beau- ty, he slowly walks toward her bed. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?  Get out of there...! Madmartigan looks down at her.  Morning rushlight il- luminates her youthful face, and her long red hair is spread across her pillow.  Out of her armor, in soft nightclothes, she looks like a goddess.  Upon her breast is a golden necklet, inlaid with ornate jewels. Quietly: MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you. He kisses her lips.  Her eyes open. SORSHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One move, and you really will be a woman. Holding the baby, Madmartigan does not move a muscle. Sorsha holds a knife at his crotch. SORSHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a fool.  Now put her back. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going to let this baby die. Sorsha presses the knife. SORSHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't make me kill you. Willow watches as Madmartigna carefully backs away from Sorsha. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe you would... Sitting up, Sorsha waves her knife.  Madmartigan places the baby in the straw crib. SORSHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you say that? MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say what? SORSHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you. Madmartigan walks back to Sorsha' bed.  Willow crawls into the tent, behind Madmartigan's back. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because it's true. SORSHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe you. Sorsha defensively kneels on her bed as Madmartigan walks toward her.  He shows no fear of her knife, com- pelled instead by honest passion.  For once, he isn't conning anybody.  His feelings are genuine. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish it weren't true.  I swore I'd never let this happen.  I hate you.  I hate your beauty, I hate your innocence, I hate the feelings you've awakened in me. The knife trembles in Sorsha's hand. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in love with you, Sorsha.  I don't want to be, but a power has enchanted me and I stand helpless against it.  It's torture.  Battle- field or prison cell was never half as cruel. He kneels onto her bed.  Her hand falls, her knife falls to the floor, her chest heaves with fear and emo- tion. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you and I can't have you so I want you all the more.  If this were another time and another place I'd-- He stops.  He looks into her eyes.  Willow dashes out of the tent with the baby. SORSHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd what? Madmartigan takes Sorsha in his arms and kisses her. Her trembling body surrenders to him.  Until: They hear a SCREAM outside the tent.  It all happens quickly.  Kael rips open the canvas and catches them in their embrace.  In one hand he holds the baby.  In the other hand:  Willow. KAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on here!! Sorsha sees the baby, sees the empty crib, and smashes Madmartigan hard across the face. SORSHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deceiver!! Kael hurls Willow across the tent and tosses the baby in the straw.  Growling horribly he lunges at Madmarti- gan.  Madmartigan rolls away and sees Sorsha's sword nearby.  Grabs it.  As Kael draws his sword, Madmarti- gan artfully slices away the center pole, and the en- tie tent collapses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bodies writhe under the fallen mass of canvas, and Ra- ziel hovers and screeches above.  Then, a silver blade slits through the tent, and out jumps Madmartigan wielding Sorsha's sword. Alarm!  Nockmaar soldiers and Death Dogs charge across the snow.  Madmartigan battles them with incredible skill, backing toward the mountain slope. Wilow crawls out from under the corner of the tent, clutchign the baby.  Madmartigan kills several so- diers, littering the snow with bodies and weapons. Willow reacts, impressed by Madmartigan's swordsman- ship.  Madmartigan makes the mistake of acknowledging it:  he bows, prod and cocky. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoops! He slips on the ice and catches himself.  Nearby a shield skids off along the snow. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willow!  Jump on the shiled! Kael howls and thrashes inside the collapsed tent. Then he gashes it open with his huge black sword.  He sees Willow and the baby get on the large shield. KAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bowmen!  Horses!  After them! Madmartigan runs toward the shield.  Archers draw their bows.  Madmartigan turns and sees Sorsha beside Kael. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorsha!  I didn't betray you.  I love you! As arrows rain down around him, Madmartigan leaps onto the shield behind Wuillow.  Sorsha watches them as they slide away down the mountain, Raziel flapping and shrieking overhead. KAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill them!! Kael waves his sward and a crack squad of Nockmaar HORSEMEN gallop down the mountain after the sled- shield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willow hugs the baby while he sits between Madmartigan's legs, and the shield zooms down the moun- tain, zig-zagging through trees.  Madmartigan steers by using Sorsha's sword as a ski pole. The Nockmaar horsemen gallop after them. The shield skips and flies over snowdrifts and bumps. Raziel squawks in terror above them.  Just missing trees and rocks, they pick up speek.  Their eyes sud- denly widen.  Dead ahead is a huge wall of ice! WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nooo!!! Willow shuts his eyes.  the shield speeds toward the wall.  At the last moment Madmartigan steers them into a small opening, little more than a crack.  Raziel, nearly smashing into the wall herself, soars up into the sky and loses them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They slide and sway down a long tube of ice, picking up incredible speed until they loop 360 degrees upside- down and around and go shooting out a hole at the other end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They soar thorugh the air.  Madmartigan and Willow shriek in terror.  But Elora Danan giggles:  she's hav- ing fun!  But in the air the shield goes one way and they go another, flipping and hanging onto one another and landing on soft snow with a fffump.  Inertia keeps them rolling. Clumped together, they tumble down the mountain, gath- ering snaw as they go, bouncing and rolling into a snowball that gets bigger and bigger and bigger and bigger and bigger!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The snowball steamrolls toward a small village at the foot of the mountain.  CHLDREN look up and squeal with delight while the adult VILLAGERS run for their lives. It plows through the middle of the village, scattering peole and animals left and right.  At last it smashes against a stone house and cracks open like an egg. Raziel flies down and lands on top of the snowball, flapping her wings frantically.  madmartigan crawls out as the villagers rush up.  They stand back in amaze- ment:  the baby starts crying. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willow!  Willow!  Are you all right? Madmartigan drags Willow and the baby out of the snow. Willow's body is limp, he's unconscious.  Then a VIL- LAGER points up at the mountain. VILLAGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: King Kael! ANOTHER VILLAGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nockmaar troops! MADMARTIGAN (to villagers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help us. In the distance Kael and his squad of about 15 horsemen charge toward the village.  The villagers flee into their huts and houses.  Madmartigan scoops up Willow and the baby.  Some villagers usher them around a corner and into a house just as Kael's army invades the town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madmartigan is bustled underground thorugh a cellar into a hidden storage room and a disguised door shuts behind him.  MEN, WOMEN and CHILDREN huddle here in silence, like refugees or criminals.  Madmartigan hands the crying baby to a WOMAN then lays Willow on the floor.  Suddenly a huge hand clamps his shoulder:  his old friend and rival Airk Thaughbaer. AIRK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madmartigan.  Settled down with a family huh? Madmartigan knocks Airk's hand away. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You left me to die, friend. AIRK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You managed alright. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this what's left of your army? Among the refugees is a handful of war-battered WARRI- ORS.  One of them, an OFFICER looks out through the ceiling beams. OFFICER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep that baby quiet. They hear hoofbeats outside.  Airk gives Madmartigan a flask of whiskey.  He squirts whiskey into Willow's mouth and Willow coughs and shudders awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raziel flies onto a rooftop and looks down.  Nockmaar soldiers flood the village, dismounting, kicking down doors, searching houses.  Then Raziel sees Kael riding alongside Sorsha. In her armor, at a distance, Sorsha looks fierce.  But CLOSER her eyes show confusion, hesitation.  Kael watches her closely as he waves his sword at the vil- lage. KAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is it!  Tell us or we'll burn your village!  Sorsha! He shakes her roughly.  She dismounts.  Raziel watches as Sorsha and two other soldiers enter the house where Madmartigan and Willow are hiding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willow holds the baby tight.  Madmartigan, Airk and the Officer watch through the cracks.  Boots pound above, shaking dust down on them.  A door opens. Nobody breathes.  Willow buries the baby in his chest. Madmartigan peeks through the door.  Sorsha, alone, comes down into the cellar.  They see her.  Searching. Airk's men reach for their swords, begin to draw. Whisper: OFFICER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill her. Madmartigam shakes his head. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll draw the others. Airk looks at Madmartigan curiously.  Madmartigan watches Sorsha. She is right there, inches away. Inaudibly, be says her name.  At last she goes back upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorsha comes up and begins to leave with the other two soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Willow's arms, the baby lets out a cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorsha and the soldiers stop and draw swords.  The baby's cry is suddenly drowned out by a loud SDRRECH. Raziel flaps in through a window and flies madly around the house, cawing and shrieking insanely.  Sorsha and the soldiers sheathe their swords and leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone sighs with relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the distance the Nockmaar army is setting houses ab- laze and Kael is terrorizing the fleeing people with his sword.  Sorsha mounts her horse.  Her attention is momemtarily caught by a MAN across the street who, from the back, looks like Madmartigan.  She gasps.  The man turns around.  She sags with disappointment, spurs her horse, and rides off. The deadly squad of Nockmaar horsemen gallops out of the village.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madmartigan and Willow come upstairs with Airk and his men. AIRK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's you they're after, Madmarti- gan.  What did you do this time? MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not after me.  They want the baby. Living in the house is a scrawny, shifty-eyed man named CUTH.  He watches and listens. AIRK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is this baby? Willow steps forward, both protective and proud. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The princess, Elora Danan. They all know of her.  They all sigh with respeck and awe, and they bow. PEOPLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The prophecy has come true. AIRK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give her to us.  We'll protect her. Raziel screeches from a ceiling beam. RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not safe!  Not safe! Willow looks up at Raziel hopefully. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're taking her to Tir Asleen. She'll be safe there from Bavmorda's powers. Airk looks up at Raziel.  Then down at Willow.  He clasps Madmartigan's arm. AIRK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tir Asleen is a myth.  It doesn't exist. RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It does!  It does!  I will show you! Airk impatiently waves the bird away and shoves Madmar- tigan in the chest. AIRK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna be a hero, Madmartigan? I've lost half my men fighting Kael, and Bavmorda, and the Nock- maar army.  Now you and this Peck, and that magpie up in the rafters, are gonna take 'em on alone? MADMARTIGAN (challenging)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then come with us. Airk angrily stabs his finger at the floor. AIRK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The war is here!  In towns and vil- lages like this! Airk crosses his arms and turns his back, looking out at the burning houses and the suffering families. AIRK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're chasing a dream. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just get me some horses. Airk glares at him furiously.  Then he kicks open the door and storms out into the street.  Madmartigan and Willow hurry after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Airk and his men, plus some villagers, watch as Madmar- tigan mounts a large horse.  Then some villagers help Willow wiggle up onto a small pony.  They sling the baby over Willow's back and stuff saddlebags with pro- visions MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once again, Airk, we say goodbye. Sadly and cynically, Airk laughs. AIRK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One day one of us willl stand on the other's grave. They shake hands ruggedly.  Madmartigan nods at Willow and they head off.  Airk watches them go, clearly am- bivalent about staying behind.  They ride up the snowy slope, Raziel circling above. WE SEE Cuth.  He scratches his filthy beard.  He sneaks off through the village, in the direction of the Nock- maar army.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snow circles around them as they climb.  Then, oddly, the mountain becomes warmer, and the snow melts away. They reach a slope of dark vitreous lava. RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nockmaar!  Nockmaar! Far away, at the top of the mountain, looms the ominous Catsle of Nockmaar.  The black lava flows from it like a deadly shadow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their horses rear up as they approach the mouth of the cave.  Raziel waits for them, circling and cawing. RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This way!  The cave! They dismount and lead the horses.  But the horses pan- ic, their frightened neighing voices echoing deep in the gloomy cave, and they break away and run off. Willow swallows hard.  He and Madmartigan follow Raziel inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daylight is soon replaced by the orange glow of molten lava. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madmartigan!  I can't stand being in closed-in places. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want me to carry Elora? WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm used to her.  How's she doing? Willow wears the papoose on his back.  Madmartigan looks in at the baby's face. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's doing a lot better than we are, Peck. Willow and Madmartigan laugh, which breaks the tension. Then a geiser of steam hisses near them and a bat screeches somewhere and the tension's back.  They keep going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hot liquid drips from the ceiling.  Hissing steam bub- bles from the floor.  they go single-file along a ledge over a foaming lava pit.  Raziel is squawking way ahead in the distance. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willow...this may be a bad time to ask this question but...what if Raziel's wrong? WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She can't be wrong.  She's a very very very powerful sorceress. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a bird, Willow. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my fault, not hers.  I've got to keep practicing.  I'm still in the learning stage but magic, Madmartigan, requires concentration and-- MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch it! WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhh! Madmartigan lunges and grabs Willow just as he is about to fall into the lava pit.  He hauls him to safety. They gasp with relief. Then they head deeper into the cave.  They stop.  They hear something.  Something strange. Then, something moves on the wall. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate this. The cave walls come to life.  Down them crawl ugly ROCK PUFFERS, pillow-sized wall crabs that screech horribly like bats.  Madmartigan fights them off with his sword. The Rock Puffers bloat themselves up, tripling their size.  Madmartigan stabs one and it hisses away like an untied balloon. Suddenly, distant hoofbeats thunder and echo.  Madmar- tigan flashes his sword and turns around, ready to de- fend Willow and the baby against the army. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go, Willow!  Run!  Run! Willow listens as the hoofbeats get louder and louder. At last he turns and runs deeper into the cave.  Mad- martigan waits. The Nockmaar soldiers, now increased to eighty, come charging down the cave.  Kael rides in the lead along- side the turncoat Cuth.  As they gallop along the ledge, Cuth makes the mistake of crowding Kael, who an- grily elbos him, horse and all, into the boiling pit. The army tramples over the Rock Puffers, which explode underfoot.  Madmartigan braces himself as they stampede toward him.  But suddenly the horseman all screech thir horses to a halt.  The horses rear and back away. Madmartigan stands there, wondering.  Then suddenly a shadow looms behind him.  He turns. The EBORSISK roars and the cave shakes and thunders. It's an enormous two-headed monster that doesn't like visitors. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willow!  Willow! He looks around frantically.  Willow is nowhere to be seen.  Then the baby cries out.  Madmartigan sees them, cowering behind a rock.  He runs toward them.  The Eborsisk exhales flames over his head. KAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go after them! Soldiers obey Kael and go after Madmartigan.  He fights them, hacking down a few, while a few others are in- cinerated by the Eborsisk.  Sorsha's horse rears as she watches Madmartigan battle for his life.  Archers shoot arrows, which pierce the Eborsisk and make it even an- grier. Willow digs one of his magic acorns out of his pocket. A head of the Eborsisk gnashes at Madmartigan.  Madmar- tigan looks to Willow for help. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry, Willow!  Throw it! Willow winds up and throws with all his might.  The Eborsisk blasts a flame, which startles Willow, wreck- ing his aim.  Madmartigan's eyes pop open and he ducks as the acorn whistles by his ear.  The acorn bounces off a rock and flies back, trickles along the ground and hits a Nockmaar soldier, who is already dead.  The soldier's body turns to stone. RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look out! One of the Eborsisk's heads lunges toward the baby. Raziel dives like a rocket and attacks the monster's eye as Willow whisks the baby away. Then Madmartigan leaps up on the Eborsisk.  He climbs up over its flaming head and drives his sword down through its skull.  The Eborsisk howls horribly and its wounded head falls.  Madmartigan topples down its back and leaps onto a horse, knocking its rider off and, all in one swashbuckling move, scooping Willow and the baby up onto the back of the horse and galloping away. KAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After them!! But as his horsement charge forward, the Eborsisk falls to its knees, half-dead.  The surviving head blasts the soldiers with fire.  They rear back on their horses and continue to battle the monster with arrows and spears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They ride out of the mouth of the dark cave into a lush valley of flowers.  In the distance stands the beau- tiful CASTLE OF TIR ASLEEN.  Raziel zooms up out of the cave an flies above them as they gallop fullspeed to- ward it.  She soars higher and higher and flies right over the castle wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door of the castle is half open.  Madmartigan and Willow gallop inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raziel flies down to meet them as they ride into the castle courtyard.  A haunting wind drones amont TWELVE PILLARS which look like stone from a distance. RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tir Asleen. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nobody here. They approach the twelve pillars. RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Knights of the Pacalcade.  The king's bravest warriors. Suddenly they hear hoofbeats and a warcry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kael and his army charge out of the cave and trample across the valley of flowers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madmartigan rushes to the heavy door and strains to shut it. RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn them back, Willow! Willow stares at the twelve knights. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?? RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Use the philosopher's stone!  Hur- ry!  Invocation!  Release them! The castle door is rusted and old.  madmartigan heaves against it.  Outside he can see the army storming to- ward him. Willow digs out his philosopher's stone.  He squints and strains, concentrating his energy. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beings within, beings without! Danu danu walkail funfawtha! He continues to chant and to concentrate.  One of the knights comes to life. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did it!  Madmartigan!  Come here! Look!  You gotta see this!  I did it! RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More!  More! Madmartigan heaves the door shut just as the army charges up, and he locks it with a huge bolt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Nockmaar horsemen rear back form the locked door. KAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Assault!  Scale the walls! He sends his men in all directions.  They leap off their horses and hack down trees from the nearby woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willow brings the knights to life, one by one. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuatha tuatha danu! Each knight shakes himself into action.  Madmartigan follows them in an armory. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raziel!  I transformed them all! I'm a magician! RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't transform them, Willow, you released them.  That was noth- ing.  Now change me. Willow's on a roll.  He rubs his hands together. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel like I could do anything! He drops to his knees and stretches his philosopher's stone apart like an accordian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madmartigan and the knights grab weapons and armor. Two knights wheel a catapult out ot the battlements. Madmartigan wees, displayed specially on a rack, a com- plete set of armor of shining silver.  He reaches out to touch it. KNIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It belonged to our king.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The knights light a fire and boil vats of oil.  Willow struggles to transform Raziel, trying to remember all he has learned. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Capture the enery...limitless power of the will...avvdachh doth indicht rredd baerkinhaekin! Raziel begins to change.  From a bird, she expands, stretches, and turns into a GOAT. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raziel?  Is that you?  Oh-oh.  What happened? Raziel tilts her goat head. RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate this. Suddenly flaming arrows rain down over the castle wall. Willow scoops up the baby and he and Raziel run for cover

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From their horses Kael and Sorsha watch as the soldiers climb the wall.  They suddenly hear a hacking noise above and several Nockmaar men tumble down the ladders. Sorsha looks up. High on the wall stands Madmartigan, magnificently dressed in the glimmering armor of the King! Kael roars and points his deadly sword up at Madmarti- gan.  Then several soldiers attack the castle door with a huge battering ram and smash it open. KAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attack!! Kael and Sorsha gallop into the castle with otehr Nock- maar horsemen, while Madmartigan continues to battle attackers on the castle wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willow looks up as the horsemen charge into the court- yeard.  He makes a run for the hallway.  SIX HORSEMEN chase after him, jumping off their horses and drawing their swords. Sorsha dismounts, draws a sword, and strides up the stairs toward teh top of the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willow runs into the armory and sets the baby down in a corner.  The six horsement run in and corner him.  He grabs an enormous broadsword.  Swings it like a base- ball bat.  The momentum of the heavy sword hurls Willow across the room.  The blade pierces a Nockmaar man. Willow grunts and yanks the sword out.  The remaining soldiers come after him.  Willow swings and flashes the sword as they close in on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the courtyard, Raziel the goat butts a few soldiers as the battle rages.

dialogues.speaker: UP ON THE WALL
dialogues.text: Madmartigan stabs a minion and sends him hurtlin down the wall.  Then he turns around.  Five more enemy swordsmen slash at him.  Madmartigan is amazing:  spin- nig, lunging, ducking, he takes out one, two, three, four of them with ease.  But not the fifth. It's the Nockmaar Lieutenant.  He and Madmartigan swordfight.  The Lieutenant hacks the sword out of Madmartigan's hand: it clatters down into the court- yeard. Madmartigan throws up his arm.  The Lieutenant's sword clangs against his wrist armor, knocking Madmartigan onto his back.  With two hands the Lieutenant lifts his sword high and goes to kill Madmartigan.  madmartigan shuts his eyes.  But nothing happens. Madmartigan opens his eyes.  the Lieutenant stands there, frozen, staring at him.  Then falls forward. Rolls over Madmartigan.  And plummets off teh wall.  In his place stands Sorsha, holding a bloodied sword. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorsha. SORSHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madmartigan. He props himself up on his elbows and smiles. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whose side are you on? She reaches down and pulls Madmartigan to his feet. SORSHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yours. They look into each other's eyes.  They go to embrace. MINION

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arrrggghhh! Out of nowhere a Nockmaar minion attacks them, his sword flashing over his head. Sorhsa hardly moves. She simply dusts him off the wall with her sword.  She turns back to Madmartigan. SORSHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you. Their armor clanks as they throw their arms around each other and kiss, high up on the castle wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kael looks up from his horse. KAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorsha!! He sees Sorsha and Madmartigan coming down the wall, fighting Nockmaar troops.  Kael holds up his great hand.  In it he holds the baby. KAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bordak! Kael waves his men after Sorsha and Madmartigan. KAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill them both! He laughs viciously then gallops toward the castle door.  As he reaches it he abruptly stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two hundred HORSEMEN are charging straight toward Kael. Led by Airk Thaughbaer! CLOSER, riding in Airk's saddlebags, with their tiny daggers flashing, are the long-lost brownies, Teemo and Rool!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kael stuffs the baby deep inside his tunic. KAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troops!  To Nockmaar!  Ride with me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kael and his men gallop across the valley of flowers and hack their way through Airk's army.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kael and his men gallop across the valley of flowers and hack their way through Airk's army.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madmartigan and Sorsha mount horses.  Willow staggers out of the armory, wounded and bleeding. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.  There were too many of them. Madmartigan scoops him up.  With seven surviving knights, they ride out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Many of Kael's men fall in battle.  But Kael and a dozen horsemen plow through and escape into the cave. Madmartigan rides up to Airk Thaughbaer and their horses powerfully dance around each other. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out for a little ride in the coun- try, Airk? AIRK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought you might get lonely, Mad- martigan! Then they drop the bravado and clasp hands. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, friend. AIRK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go. They charge into the cave.  The clamor of their hoofbeats echoes and then fades to silence.  The valley is littered with fallen soldiers. Then, Raziel trots out of the castle.  She clip-clops across the valley and follows the others to the cave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Nockmaar horsemen race out of the cave and gallop up the obsidian mountain toward the dark castle. The army of Tir Asleen thunders out of the cave in pur- suit. Arrows fire back and forth.  The Tir Asleen army stays right on the enemy's tail.  Willow hangs on to Madmar- tigan for dear life. Airk and Madmartigan ride side by side, perfect team- work, and cut a few Nockmaar ment down. Then Madmartigan turns and sees Sorsha ride up past everybody.  What a rider she is!  She surprises a cou- ple of Nockmaar soldiers, swordfighting as she rides, killing them both.  But she can't catche Kael.  He rides ahead of everyone else, whipping his horse at an in- credible speed toward the castle. The chase continues up the mountain.  The Tir Asleen army keeps firing arrows at the enemy, or cutting them down with their swords, until only two Nockmaar men ride behind Kael.  At last Kael reaches the castle drawbridge and leaps onto it as it begins to rise.  His two remaining horsemen leap after him but fall short and tumble into the dry craggy moat. The drawbridge shuts with a loud echoing KLUNGG!  Mad- martigan and Arik screech to a halt on the brink of the moat.  They look up.  The castle loom, huge, dark, powerful, evil. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorsha!  Any way in there? Sorsha rides up to his side. SORSHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  The fortress is protected on all sides. The Tir Asleen warriors, dwarfed by the huge black wall, look at one another with doubt and worry. AIRK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make camp!  We'll assault at dawn. The army dismounts and begins to unpack supplies.  It is late in the day and shadows lengthen toward evening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kael carries the baby through the castle and climbs up the gloomy narrowing stairs of the QUEEN'S TOWER.  He comes to a large door and hesitates a moment, showing fear.  Then creaks the door open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAVMORDA looks up.  Kael cowers, afraid of her evil power. BAVMORDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kael! Carved in the floor is a MAGICIAN's CIRCLE, and in the very middle of this is a sacrificial altar made of shining copper.  Bavmorda stands over the altar, wear- ing black robes.  Behind her stand two decrepit DRUIDS. Kael bows. KAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Queen Bavmorda.  I have the child. The baby squirms and cries.  Seething with hate, Bav- morda reaches out her arms, then shrinks back. BAVMORDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We must start the ritual! She hears noise outside the castle. BAVMORDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is that? KAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An army of rebels and traitors. Bavmorda closes her eyes, holds out her hands and feels the vibrations and energy around her.  Psychically: BAVMORDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is Sorsha? KAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has turned against you. Bavmorda opens her eyes furiously.  to her druids: BAVMORDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Purify the altar!  Arrange the im- plements!  I'll deal with Sorsha! The druids take the baby from Kael.  Bavmorda storms out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Tir Asleen rebels pitch tents and build fires. Then they feel a terrible presence and look up at the castle wall.  Amid torches and hideous minions, Bavmor- da leers down at them and laughs. BAVMORDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not an army! Sorsha looks up, and her mother seems to laugh right at her.  Madmartigan steps forward.  Seeing him in the ar- mor of the King, Bavmorda stops laughing, taken aback. RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willow!  Get out of here!  Quick! Hide! Raziel suddenly butts Willow into a tent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willlow tumbles into the tent and Raziel follows him. RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get down!  The ritual chant! Quick!  Protect yourself! WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just do it! Willow takes out his philosopher's stone and begins to chant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madmartigan faces the queen. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've come for Elora Danan!  Turn her over to us! Bavmorda stabs her finger down at him. BAVMORDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You dare to challenge me?  You are not warriors.  You're pigs! She waves her hand, casting a horrible spell over the army.  Madmartigan's body begins to change its shape. His armor breaks apart.  He grows hideous. BAVMORDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're all pigs! The rebel soldiers panic and run.  Slowly, horribly, they all expand and contort, ripping out of their armor and clothers, casting down their weapons and shields. SORSHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother!  No!! BAVMORDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You made your decision! Bavmorda points at Sorsha, and Sorsha, too, begins to change.  The mountainside becomes a sea of writhing flesh.  Every one of the Tir Asleen army is transformed into a pig. INT. QUEEN'S TOWER - DUSK Bavmorda throws open the door.  Her druids are binding the baby in a leather thong. BAVMORDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Begin the ritual.  Now!  Light the first candle. A druid lights on of THIRTEEN ENORMOUS CANDLES.  Bav- morda glares up at the roof.  In the middle of it is a large circular hole showing the starlit sky. BAVMORDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come, thunder.  Come lightning. Touch this altar with your pwer. Come into my tower... Lightning flashes faintly and thunder rumbles in the distance.  Bavmorda smiles with satisfaction. A druid places teh baby on the altar.  The other druid hits a loud gong, once.  Bavmorda enters the Magician's Circle.  Her face contorts as she recites: BAVMORDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark runes, dark powers!  Blend and bind, bind and blend, Universal night!  And the might of Nockmaar! Magically she produces a razor-sharp knife.  Lightning flashes again, getting closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willow is crouched on his knees, chanting with her eyes closed. RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's over, Willow.  You did well. You protected yourself. Willow looks up.  He hears the grunting outside.  With great trepidation, he crawls to the tent door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willow shudders in horror at the grotesque sight.  Amid horses and tents and weapons, hundreds of pigs wander about.  Willow stands and walks through them.  He looks down at one point and sees Rool and Teemo:  two tiny baby pigs.  Then he turns and runs back into the tent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willow collapses to his knees beside Raziel. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've come all this way and now Elora Dana's going to die! RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  I can still defeat Bavmorda! WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's too powerful, Raziel Raziel sternly stamps the ground with her hoof. RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A true magician, Willow, never surrenders.  She is a sorceress--I am a sorceress!  Transform me now and I will destroy her!  Hexagram! Willow grabs a sword and draws a hexagram around Ra- ziel.  He steps outside of it, holds up his philosopher's stone and begins his magic. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banish all disturbing forces from  this place.  Fire, water, above and below.  Balance.  Balance.  Bal- ance. Raziel begins to change.  Willow wrestles with his own powers of concentration and will, now and then losing strength. RAZIEL (voice distorted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't give up!  Willow! He chants and strains.  Raziel momentarily changes into a partly-formed grotesque creature.  Then into a deer. Then she becomes human.  At last she becomes herself, a once-beautiful and now elderly woman.  Willow covers her unclothed body with a simple smock. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raziel! She looks down at her old hands.  Then her eyes focus with purpose. RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got a lot of work to do, Wil- low.  Bring in our brave men. Willow opens the tent.  Some pigs shuttle in, and Ra- ziel begins to change them back into warriors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stationed high on the castle wall, three Nockmaar MIN- IONS laugh and drink.  Then they hear the terrible SCREAM of the baby.  They look up at the Queen's Tower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A druid hits the ceremonial gong, twice.  The baby shrieks.  Standing over her, Bavmorda crushes a piece of glass with her bare hands and drops the fragments into a Witch's Bottle. BAVMORDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black fire forever kindled within, Let the second right begin! With a pair of razor-sharp shears she clips the baby's tiny fingernails and sprinkles them into the Witch's Bottle.  The bottle glows and sparks, and teh heavens asnwer with distant thunder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the dark Tir Asleen camp some figures crouch low and hurry from tent to tent.  CLOSER, the faces of rebel warriors, watching the castle wall.  Fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willow, Raziel, Madmartigan, Sorsha, Airk Thaughbaer and a dozen rebel warriors argue back and forth. AIRK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uphill with our rough weapons, we'll never make it! SORSHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elora Danan will die! RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By dawn, upon thirteen tolls of the runic drum! WARRIOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bavmorda is too powerful.  We need more forces.  I say we retreat! The other warriors agree. RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bavmorda cannot transform you. I've protected this camp with a spell. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you use your magic to get our men into the fortress, Raziel? Raziel shakes her head. RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bavmorda has shielded it with a spell of her own. The warriors grumble and protest.  In a corner, Rool and Teemo poke their heads in under the canvas.  Curi- ously they look at Willow, who sits in silence and deep though, scratching the ground with his fingernail. The warriors rumble. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait!! Willow jumps to his feet.  They all turn to him. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have an idea.  Back in my village we catch a lot of hedgehogs. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willow, this is war, not agricul- ture! WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I know!  But this is a way to get into that castle... The all gather around Willow to listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thunder rumbles.  Bavmorda looks up.  Her face is gra- dually becoming more grotesque as the ritual proceeds. A druid hits the gong three times.  Now three candles are lit.  The baby screams on the altar. With a demonic laugh, Bavmorda digs her hands into a deep vat of blood then raises them over her head.  The blood runs down her arms into the folds of her black cloak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all look at Willow. AIRK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too much work. WARRIOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It can't be done. SORSHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kael will never fall for it. Willow looks hopefully at Madmartigan. MADMARTIGAN (doubtful)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, Willow. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madmartigan, you promised me you'd take care of Elora Danan like your own daughter.  She is all that matters.  Are you going to abandon her? Madmartigan turns away and scratches his beard. AIRK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Madmartigan.  you gonna listen to a Peck?  You and I are warriors.  You know this plan will never work. Frustrated and torn, Madmartigan brushes Airk away. The men rally with Airk.  Mdmartigan goes over to Sor- sha. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll probably die here, Sorsha. SORSHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no family. The gong rings four time.  Raziel turns to Airk and his men. RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we do not fight, and the baby dies, all hope for the future is lost.  I shall face the danger alone if I have to. The men shake their heads. WILLOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me, too. Madmartigan, still torn by indecision, raises his arm and silences the protest. MADMARTIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time is running out.  We must now decide who's going to leave and who is going to stay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Light pulsates in the Queen's Tower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The druids cower behind Bavmorda, whose face has taken on the hideous features of a hellish beast.  The baby has been streaked with ritual paint. BAVMORDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ocht veth nockkthirth bordak! Her voice growls a sickening chant, and light shoots out of her claw-liek fingers, enveloping the baby.  The baby levitates above the altar in a cocoon of light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun rises over the volcanic mountain.  The gong strikes twelve times.  PAN ACROSS the slope outside the castle.  The Tir Asleen army is gone.  Littered across the ground are flattened tents, borken wagons an dis- carded shields.  The wind howls, taking bits of debris with it. Alone on the deserted mounatinside stand Willow and Rz- ziel. RAZIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time is running out. WILLOW
